title: Moldy
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Advertised as a 4 star hotel but absolutely not
review: The location was great. When we walked in the room it smelly kinda flowery. Turns out they were covering up smells. My room had no mold but others in our tour did. The staff were nice to me but their were two big tour groups and they didn't have enough dishes to go around.

title: Terrible
review: Dear hollyh812,  thank you very much for your review and for the praises to the staff.  I'm sorry if something got wrong with the room assigned to you but it seems to me very strange what you report regarding mold in the room which is a thing that we have never experienced (one can have a look to the other comments about our cleanliness to understand what I mean) .  it is rather and more likely a maintenance problem related to the leaks of the tiles and the silicones of the bathrooms that are to be replaced shortly for which I apologize .  Best regards  Giani Andreucci Direttore Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Comfortable stay for conference journey.
review: This hotel is definitely not a 4 star hotel. AC wasn’t working properly in 97 degree weather. Room felt like a sauna. Asked management if we can switch rooms and they flat out lied telling us there aren’t any open. Upon calling our travel agent who contacted them, they moved us to another room where the AC was STILL NOT working. Other problems included a TV that wouldn’t turn on, leaking towel racks, and no open outlet plugs.... oh and if you get a room with a queen bed, expect 2 twin size beds pushed together. I swear the crease in between gave me some back problems.

title: No Air Conditioner in 34 degrees temperature !
review: Dear Vacation733317,  thanks for your comment   I really regret for the inconvenience with the a/c that has generated your complaints that I can only accept because we actually had a technical  problem with the a/c during 15/20 days of this last summer that has now completely and totally solved.   I apologize to you and hope you will give you another chance to Palazzo Ognissanti if in the next future you will come back to Florence. I assure you that we will strive to make your stay memorable.  Best regards  Gianni Andreucci Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Another great location for our visit
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Disappointing
review: My travel friend and I like to stay in neighborhoods to get a feel of community.  That is this hotel.  Out of the general tourist area but walking distance to everything, including train station.  I enjoy looking out the window and seeing the local activity.   A nice restaurant nearby.  Two tour busses of people arrived during our stay, but the staff accommodated everyone well.  Ample buffet breakfast.  Free coffee and tea in the lobby.  Only complaint is small shower and poor water pressure.

title: Great Location!
review: Hello southbaytravelers,  thank you for posting this review.  As you could notice our pleasant staff is willing to meet every guest's requirements ( when possible): it's our way of let a client feel like if he was at his home.  Position and breakfast are other two point of strength of Palazzo Ognissanti: thank you for highlight this thing .  Best regards  Gianni Andreucci Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Not a 4 star hotel
review: Although boasting a 4 star status, it is not. The rooms are small, bathrooms smaller still and both in need of an update. Staff service can vary between helpful and downright rude. Although the room information claims that the bar is open from 7:00am to 11:00pm, upon returning at 10:30 one evening and asking for a drink at the deserted bar, we were told that it was closed. When I pointed out to the receptionist their claim that it is open until 11:00pm, she just put her face in her hands, sighed loudly and turned back to her computer screen. Breakfast was good at least, and the location is good.

title: Lot of Issues Need to be Addressed
review: Staff were friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was good and the service was outstanding from the waitstaff.  Being a travel agent I am always on the lookout for hotels I am comfortable sending my clients to and this is one I will keep in mind.

title: Bigger room than thought I would receive
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Friendly staff and a great place to stay
review: I truly have no complaints. Room is quite spacious for solo visitor. Room can accommodate 2, if truth be known.  Staff VERY accommodating esp for my additional towel requests and when I have a brain freeze and can't figure out how to turn on TV or turn off lights.  I'm on vacation, I'm automatically in Stupid mode and I thank them for not holding that against me.  Overall, no complaints. On the 1st floor and although others have complained abt the noise, I'm a New Yorker and noise is my lullaby so does not bother me at all.  My ONLY concern/peeve --> shower is WAY too small. It's closed in and if I weighed more, no way i would EVER fit. I turn around and accidentally turn off the water.  They could've made it a tad bigger. Feel almost like I'm in a standup coffin --> it's THAT…

title: Nice hotel at a great price
review: From the photos I had the impression of somewhere past its best. I was wrong! While not 4 star luxury, it was good quality with very pleasant and helpful staff, a very well appointed breakfast room (and a quality breakfast). I asked for a kettle when I arrived and a tray came within minutes, brought by a porter in uniform. My room (a single) was large enough with a good shower room and well appointed. It is close to the river and it took me 10 minutes to walk to the Ponte Vecchio and the Duomo. Several cheap restaurants are within 250m.  I have read comments that the rooms at the front of the hotel are noisy (street noise) and I can imagine in the summer with the windows open, that they would be. However, in February I had the double glazed windows, the curtains and the internal…

title: 3 night stay
review: Good morning RetiredGeoff,  it's been so good that you've changed your mind about our hotel.  Our staff and breakfast are unanimously recognized as two strong point at Palazzo Ognissanti and I'm glad that you have noticed and emphasized  this aspect too.  My warmest regards  Gianni Andreucci Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Oh boy!
review: We got this hotel as part of a deal and it was a great offer. The hotel is a ten minute stroll from Firenze station and is in an area that has been reported as being ‘run down’. It is a bit shabby but it is an old area and a lot of Florence is like this. It is very safe and we walked without a problem night or day. It is about a twenty minute walk fro the Duomo and it’s a fairly straightforward route. The hotel is clean tidy and the staff were very helpful and let us store our days on the last day. The room was average size and ours was on the ground floor facing the road. People had reported it was noisy and the did empty the rubbish bins on the opposite side of the road at about 6am but really it wasn’t that noisy. We wake early anyway and I don’t think it would have woken us…

title: Excellent location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. title: Convenient Location - Average Hotel
review: Nice hotel, well situated 5 minutes walk from the railway station and within reasonable walking distance of most , if not all of the many attractions on offer in Florence. Plenty of good bars and restaurants close by. We very much liked a restaurant called ' O' Munaciello which is situated on the far side of the river Arno about 10 minutes walk away. This restaurant was recommended to us by a fellow guest at the hotel and we enjoyed it so much that we returned a couple of times.It was very busy so best to book in advance if you plan to go there.  My wife and I visited Florence with friends and we found the hotel to be perfect for our needs. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. The staff were helpful and friendly and always went out of there way to speak. As other…

title: Nice Hotel
review: I recently spent a week in this hotel with a group of people and consider it to be an average OK hotel but more attention to detail could make it better. It is certainly in a very convenient place from which to visit all the major attractions of Florence, being close to the Railway Station and the River Arno with a 15 to 20 minute walk to the Uffizi Gallery and the Ponte Vecchio. There are also local buses close by.There are several reasonably priced restaurants within a few minutes walk from the hotel. The staff are friendly, helpful  and pleasant, the breakfast offers a very good choice, the hotel is clean and the beds comfortable and all basic amenities, including free WiFi, are provided. Now for the buts: The rooms at the front face onto the street and the noise from the…

title: Great location and wonderful staff!
review: Dear Footlooseatlast,  I really thank you for the nice praises to our professional and pleasant staff and to the breakfast, made up of fresh and high quality products.  Regarding your observations about the furniture, common areas  and the rooms it will be my commitment to refer everything to my property.  Best regards  Gianni Andreucci Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Perfect location and excellent staff
review: We enjoyed our stay here, breakfast was delicious, staff were friendly and helpful. Every time you entered the building they would stop what they would always say hello.  We absolutely loved the shut off blinds, so you could make the room dark anytime of the day.  Great position.

title: Pathetic experience. Never ever book a room here!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Rude Staff .
review: I had the worst experience staying in this hotel. I and my wife were on a Euro trip travelling across several cities in Italy, Switzerland and France. Amongst all the hotels, this hotel was the worst. To add salt to my injuries, this was one of the 4-star hotel which I had booked and it was poorer than even 3-star hotels where I had a great time.   It was very hot in Florence and the AC didn't work at all. After complaining, a guy came and instead of trying to fix the problem he gave us a table fan to use in the room. The next day when I complained again, I was told that nothing can be done as it is a Friday and maintenance people won't come to fix it as the weekend is approaching. Also, there was no alternate room available where I could have shifted to. Even if I did get an…

title: Great Hotel!
review: When you first walk in the hotel you are overwhelmed  by the perfume scent they have going on . Gives you a headache !!  The front desk people personality coming into the hotel are very Somber , like they rather be some place else.  If you go in with a happy positive vibe by the time you get to your room you feel drained by the staff .    Let’s talk Taxi Cabs .  The male staff Will YELL at you if you want to change your time form 7am to 6:40am . He will tell you he will have to pay 15€ .  Even tho I offered to pay that fee . Which by the way the taxi company waived . When i asked him to please stop yelling at me & I understand where he is coming from . That it’s no way to talk to a customer this way . He gets even more ticked off .  As  a first timer visiting Florence I was…

title: No air conditioning
review: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in August 2018. The hotel is about a 2 minute walk from the SMN Train Station- don't bother taking a taxi! We did and it was 10 Euro- such a waste of money.  We were greeted warmly when we checked in. Our room was very clean and welcoming.  Some things to highlight: -your room has a fridge and there are a couple of bodegas across the street from the hotel so you can purchase cold drinks and snacks, etc. -after traveling for awhile, we both needed to do laundry. There is a laundromat directly across the street from the hotel- very convenient. -the location can't be beat! We were a short walk from some of Florence's biggest attractions. I've noticed a few reviews state that there was no air conditioning. When we stayed, the AC was…

title: Could have been better
review: Dear MKB2883,  I than you so much for your nice comment, especially for emphazising our fantastic position, near to the Train Station ( only 300 meters), Duomo and Ponte Vecchio,  surrounded as we are  by car rental centers, restaurants, bar and laundromats.  Thank you for the praises to cleanliness and kindness of our employees, 2 other strong points of Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti.  Warm regards  Gianni Andreucci Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Nice and Comfortable Stay
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Wery god breakfast and friendly stuff.
review: Pros: - The location of this hotel is ideal, very close to Florence Station ( Firenze SMN) and walking distance to all key tourist locations.  - The front desk are very helpful and provide great tips on destinations and places to eat.  - They offer breakfast which was really good (eggs, bread, cheese, juice, cakes, muffins, etc).  - The rooms are good too, clean and sound-proof and bathrooms are clean too.  - The rooms have kettle and you can leave the A/C ON whilst outside too, which is a bonus in the hot weather.   Cons: - My only issue was limited lighting (somewhat dull) in the room, you can leave the windows open but not sure if that would be everyone's preference.

title: Palace Needs Refurbishing
review: Location is perfect, max 10 min walk from the train / bus station, I'll would say 10-15 min walk to most of the attractions. My room 105 with a dubble bed was quite ok for me, not a wery big room but enuff.  The hotel staff is very polite and helpful. The best is the breakfast with a lot of food / juice etc.etc to select from.  I'll be back Thanks

title: Wonderful staff, miniscule room, horribly noisy at night
review: Very dated. One could argue that it is an old Palace, granted. But we have stayed in palaces turned into hotels before and they were exquisite.   The bed was supposed to be a queen but it was comprised of 2 singles placed together. Both beds were on individual wood bed frames (no box spring). Felt like cots. We couldn’t cuddle because the 2 beds were at slightly different heights...  The room was very small. The old plaster walls were in serious need of paint and they were dirty, as were the floors.   No coffee pot or kettle in the room. No way to even get a cup of tea upon our arrival.   As an aside, we had not knowingly booked this hotel. We booked it through Hotwire, which we will never do again. Hotwire used to be a great service whereby the hotel name was revealed after you…

title: Very pleasant stay!
review: Dear marlog581,  it seems that our description on HotWire.com ( a website we have no direct contract with at all!!) shows a different hotel, than the one Palazzo Ognissanti is.  The important thing that I would like to state again is that our hotel fully complies all  law requirements stated for 4 star hotel in our country, both for furnitures and services. Kettle and coffee pot are available upon request for every guest, as reported in all the websites we work with. Most of all, each guest arriving during the day can enjoy tea, coffee and pastries: this is a free service we offer for client at the check in, daytime. May be you arrived late in the night.. I'm sorry that you have missed it.  My regards  Gianni Andreucci Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Lovely staff and very clean hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Near river Arno and close to Ponte Veccio
review: We stayed at this hotel as part of a tour package and initially was surprised that the hotel was older than expected. We were quite pleased with how wonderful our stay was due to the lovely and helpful front door staff, the nice breakfast, the proximity to everything and the cleanliness of the rooms. The street can get a bit noisy in the evening but after a long day out and about, it's not that noticeable.  Many thanks to the wonderful staff!

title: Super clean and cute!!
review: Hello Maria M,  I would like to thank you for the nice review, in particular for the kind words about breakfast and cleanlines but most of all to our staff, made up of people who go out of their ways to help our guests feel like at home.  My warmest regards  Gianni Andreucci Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Sleeping in a shop front
review: Delicious breakfast and especially lemon jam filled crouassans. It's located near river Arno so you can find tourist places easily walking by the river. You will have access to hot water and crouassans 24 hours a day

title: excellent
review: Dear Narmin R,  it was a pleasure to get this nice review form your part: thank you for the words about the breakfast where we are used to serve only fresh and high quality products, amongst which the pastries that we get from one of the most prestigious confectionery of Florence.  Location is undoubtedly one of our strength. Ponte Vecchio, Duomo and Uffizi museum are only a few steps from our hotel... a big advantage for everyone willing to know our beautiful city!  My warmest regards  Gianni Andreucci Manage Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Exceeded expectations
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Palazzo ognissanti - delightful ..
review: There are many negative reviews for this hotel which from our experience are totally unwarranted. The standards of cleanliness, decor and breakfast week of the highest order. The staff could not have been more helpful or friendly. This is not a soulless modern check you in check you out hotel but a place with real character and atmosphere.

title: I can't believe that I stay here
review: Hello SoniandPaddy,  your review made us start the day on the right foot.  You couldn't be more accurate in describing our structure: Palazzo Ognissanti is not a sophisticated, classy hotel, but a clean, cozy place where people welcome you with a smile on their face. We strongly believe that these details can always make the difference....  Thank you very much!  My warmest regards  Gianni Andreucci Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Ok, but not impressive
review: Friendly efficient helpful staff! Comfortable room, delicious breakfast and great service. Well located to Firenze Train and beautiful Italian churches, Museums and Galleries. Staff most helpful with advice about walking to Duomo, Academia, Uffitzi, Ponte Vecchio, buses or trains to Fiesole to enjoy the view over Florence and the Etruscan, Roman ruins and Museum. Even with intermittent light rain and bursts of sun, the city and surrounds were breathtaking ..  Reception team and Manager most helpful with directions to recommended local restaurants and trattoria! Delicious Tuscan food, wine, beer!

title: Very good hotel
review: Dear Helen S,  it was really nice to get this kind review from you: thank you very much, especially for the personal praises to me and my staff made up of efficient and charming people that I'm proud to direct.  If you come back to Florence again, we hope to be your first choice.  My warmest regards  Gianni Andreucci Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Horrible first night
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Lovely place... would go back !
review: We (my husband and I) stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The first evening when we arrived, the lady at the reception was very friendly. The check-in went very smooth. The reception looked fancy and shiny so I was very excited to see our room.  Our room (15) was located at the end of the hallway on the ground floor. The room was spacious enough for 2 people. Nothing as fancy as the reception. It was an old room and the walls could use a bit of fresh paint. But it's for sleeping, so no biggy. The bed was 2 beds pushed together. The sheets were clean, but the blanket on top was old and rough.   The bathroom was simple and very clean with towels and small shower gels/shampoo/soap. Really old shower head which seemed a bit broken. When someone in another room flushed the toilet you…

title: No Air conditioning.  They send up a fan.
review: Dear guest,  thank you for taking a little time and live us a review.  I'm pleased for what you said about our staff and breakfast and I thank you for your ince praises.  As per regards to the room furniture and to the rooms assigned to you, I apologize for the inconvenience experienced, especially the one  with the second room that anyway now has been completely solved. I will report to my property each one of your remarks regarding our product.  Best regards  Gianni Andreucci Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Disappointed
review: We arrived late because the sister hotel we had booked was full, so we were taxied back downtown to this hotel. Our first room was street level and we asked for a balcony room, and presto we got a second floor room with balcony. It's Italian size but all amenities are present. Open the shuttered doors and you are on the balcony with a decent view of the street, and the bridge. The ac worked fine for us , sometimes too cold and controls are awkward. Very clean room and hotel. Staff most accommodating and pleasant, language not an issue. Breakfast was great and best coffee of all hotels, not machine made, and best of all they always have a pot available all day along with pastries...nice touch. Location is superb , restaurants and shops all around, walking distance to tourist…

title: Recommended
review: Dear Guysview,  than you so much for taking time to share your opinion about our hotel with all the Tripadvisor users.  I'm really glad for your nice words about our location (really a strong point since we are only 300 meters far from the train station and a short distance from the main tourist and business sites), to the room and cleanliness as well as for the praises to our delicious breakfast, made up of only fresh and high quality products.  Most of all, I would like to thank you for emphasizing the little corner that  I have set along the  the bar area, where  tea, coffee and fresh  pastries left form the morning buffet are offered for free for several hours. It's a little thing that gives us much satisfaction in terms of good feedbacks and reputation.  If one day you decide to come back to Firenze, we are here waiting for you to stay at  Palazzo Ognissanti again!  My warmest regards   Gianni Andreucci Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Highly disappointed
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Amazing Service!
review: Air conditioner in our room was not very effective....breakfast was not good ...items were over not refilled....awful smell on the 2nd floor after late evening.. V average hotel... location is the only gud point I can say...

title: Great service
review: Good morning Dhruva,  thank you for the comment and for the good words regarding our position.  I really regret if something got wrong with the a/c (now the situation is completely normal), and if you had to wait a little bit at the breakfast in the morning.... we are human beings and sometimes when the breakfast hall is full  our efficient clerks may need some minutes more to refill the items: I think this fact has leaded  you to get a confused perception of our breakfast, which is made up of fresh and high quality products.  I apologize to you for this inconvenience, nevertheless.  It's the first time that a guest refers to a bad smell in our hotel: actually our housekeeper Rossella is very scrupulous and she is usually able to give a  very  good smell to all the common areas and rooms.   As per regards to our hotel category, I'm very glad to inform you and all the Tripdvisor users that our structure totally meets the requirements stated by law for 4 hotels in our country. I'm really  sorry if you were not in a position to figure it out.  Best regards  Gianni Andreucci Direttore  Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Disappointed
review: Great location for a hotel! Near by train station and just a short walk from the city center. Just wanted to say a special thank you to Francesca at the front desk for being extremely accommodating, understanding, and helpful. Thanks!!!

title: hotel in good location staff delightful but rooms small and drab
review: Good morning Cj S,  you let us start the day on the right food with this beautiful review!  Thank you so much from all the members of our charming staff, and in particular in the name of Francesca who is one of our crown jewels at the Front Desk. We do our best to make our guests feel at home and we're pleased when we get this  kind of nice feedback.  I hope that if one da you come back to Florence, Palazzo Ognissanti will be your first choice: it will be a real pleasure to serve you again .  My warmest regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Nice Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Perfectly adequate
review: Nice hotel with good location. Small breakfast zone would make some problems but breakfast is really good and various. Our room was a bit small but enough for two. Hotel is 450 Meters to train station and around 10 minutes to Duomo. I would suggest to every body.

title: Good location however a few improvements required
review: The hotel is nicely situated between the train station (but not too close!) and the river - a pleasant walk from pretty much everything you've probably gone to Florence to see.  Prior to arrival the staff answered emails promptly and, during our stay were able to arrange a restaurant for a large group booking at very short notice. My booking was for a single room and I can join the other reviewers who have commented that these tend to be quite small - as I was not intending to re-stage the Olympics or entertain guests, this was really not a problem.  The bed was comfortable (a deliciously hard mattress) and extra pillows/blankets were available.  The wardrobe was fine although a hanger or two more would have been welcome and the drawers in the dressing table were very shallow…

title: Good location, great breakfast, mediocre room
review: The hotel location is perfect, near to everything you could possibly want, transport links, shops, stunning architecture and historical sights. Such a beautiful city!!! The facilities at the hotel are ok, the rooms are adequate but there are some issues which need to be addressed. The light is in the rooms is dull, only coming from 2 out of 3 lamps available as one didn't work. The sound on the tv didn't work, we we're on the ground floor and i would defiantly recommend earplugs because of the noise from passers by and dustcarts.  The choice of drink at the bar is very limited and not very well stocked, in fact the beer we had was out of date but we weren't charged.  The worst thing was the fact that the beds we're so hard so we had a very uncomfortable few nights.  If these…

title: Florentine jewel, perfect for exploring
review: How much you like this hotel will probably depend on how much time you spend indoors. I was there to have breakfast, sleep and shower, so it was absolutely fine for the few nights I was in Florence, but if you like to hang around and chill in your room it'd be less fine.  First off, location: five minutes from the main train station and where the shuttle from Peretola stops, a block from the Arno, a few streets off the fancy shopping district of Tornabuoni and about twenty minutes walk from Ponte Vecchio, it's pretty conveniently located for almost everything. There's a minimarket around the corner, some good restaurants within a few minutes walk, and the Mercato Centrale is about ten minutes away - perfect for all your food needs. It's a surprisingly busy and noisy street in…

title: Nice stay!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great location
review: My husband and I stayed here for only one night the day we arrived in Firenze. It was conveniently located very close to the train station where we walked from to the hotel. The staff was great and rooms were very nice. We didn't wake up in time for breakfast, so I can't review on that. My husband and I were tired from jet-lag.

title: Location
review: Just at walking distance from the train station. Near from major points of interests.  Staff is very helpful and friendly . Very good breakfast,a lot of choice ,fresh ,high quality food. Small room ,small bathroom, but clean. Near a lot of restaurants of all range of prices.Near Ponte Vecchio were you can buy beautiful hand made purse .Be aware of full of leather ,from China, with Firenza stamped on it ....Near a gelateria ,Carrera, with the best gelatos in town.

title: Ideal solo for a few days
review: This hotel is only good for one or at the most two days of stay  Very small rooms the one facing road are very noisy cas the garbage truck makes lot of noise very early in morning  Breakfast has limited options  Good for transit stay

title: A bad hotel in a good location!!!
review: Very convenient location. Small but clean, comfortable room. Wonderful breakfast with fresh baked breads, pastries and a selection of meats and cheeses. Free Wi-Fi. Attentive staff. Overall a very good option with very reasonable prices in many cases.

title: Tiny Room...But Some Good Points
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good Place to Stay
review: I booked the Palazzo Ognissanti for a recent 5 night business stay in Florence. First, I must say I had very short (3 days) notice that I was taking the trip, and hotels withing my "company allowable" range were not easy to find.  Upon arrival, the young lady behind the desk was very friendly; however, there was nobody to help me with my bags - not a complaint but in my travels to Florence in other 4 star hotels, this is something that seems standard. As the title of my review states, my room was a single and was VERY small. A single bed against the wall, a small desk and a small closet, no dresser. The bathroom was ok sized but the shower was tiny - it was hard for me to even take a shower, and I am a pretty average size guy. I also had some trouble with the toilet running, but…

title: Location is the key!
review: A nice hotel, placed close to the railway and bus stations. Almost five to seven minutes walk,(without heavy luggage, :)). First day not treated too well probably because payment was made in advance and waited for long for early check in. Given to another client. Probably because we were not Europeans!!!!!  Guided well by the hotel staff to venture out for the day excursions.   A better fare for breakfast expected since the next day also same things were there.

title: Not too bad!
review: The room was comfortable and quite. The location was just perfect for all activities that we planed! The amenities was exactly that we were ask for. And I have to say that the breakfast was very good too!

title: Florence vacation
review: Not a bad hotel however I found the room and the shower very small. Breakfast is adequate and the location is excellent too. The staff very helpful and they had understanding of the English language which obviously does come very helpful.

title: A quick stop in Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Not too bad
review: After arriving from Rome mid morning, our room wasn't ready so we walked around the city.  There are so many places of interest within walking distance of the hotel.  In just 3 hours we hit almost every church, market, museum and bridge.  The hotel itself is just Ok as the shower is way too small and the room rather compact.  But we had terrace balcony right out our door so that more than made up for it.  The breakfast was great, especially the brie and other cheeses, fresh fruit, meats and varieties of baked goods. If you walked away hungry then you had a problem. All in all, i would stay at the Palazzo Ognissanti again. Everyone at the front desk that I encountered was terrific.  A special thanks to Harsh for making a few calls for me to tour operators.

title: Right in the middle of Florence!
review: It has a good location and a good breakfast, but the rooms could be better. They look dirty and the sheets have stains on them. The rooms are a bit small too. It is a 3 minute walk to the river and another 15 minutes to Ponte Vecchio.

title: Profiteering
review: So we worried a bit when we found a hotel in the middle of Florence, in August, that we could afford. I worried even more as I followed the instructions of my Sat Nav into ever tightening cobbled streets. The hotel, with its huge marble sculpture in the lobby, did nothing to assuage our fear that booking.com had the prices wrong. Even when I took the car the nearby garage did I feel secure that at some point I was going to be ripped off. However, what a super hotel. Lovely rooms, with a balcony. Excellent breakfast, and despite it's well dodgy appearance, great parking. All within a five minute walk of the Ponte Vechio!

title: Great stay…
review: We were booked into this hotel by 'low cost holidays' who went bankrupt.  We found this out a week before we were due to travel.  I emailed the hotel to find out what was happening and make some room arrangements and they didn't even bother to reply.  The agent we booked through contacted them and were told the room had been booked and when they stated we still wanted the room were told it had been cancelled but would not say who by. The room was still available and when they were told we would pay again for the room they demanded nearly 4 times the original cost!  This is just profiteering from victims and my advice is ask the question 'If something similar happened with your booking would you be happy this hotel would treat you fairly?" Your choice but I wouldn't!

title: Good base for stay in florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Enjoyable stay!
review: Stayed in July with my husband and daughter. Our triple room is on the 4th floor, I was expecting the room to be hot but it was nice and pleasant. Very clean, bedding and room itself needs updating. Breakfast is good lots of cereals cold cuts bread cheese and fruits. Coffee was excellent.  Reception was very friendly and profesional, we arrived quite late in the day and the lady made sure check in was quick.  We hired a car driving into florence they dont provide free parking but they do have agreement with Garage Excelsior where we parked our car for 20 euros a dat, seems steep, but wverything in florence is!  Drive by to Val d' Orcia a 2 hr drive from Florence to see the magnificent florence country side! For the best gelato in florence try armorino's! We had a great lunch at…

title: Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti
review: I stayed here for 14 nights in the second two weeks of July. Firstly I flew into Pisa and took the Autostradale coach from the airport, which takes about an hour and drops you off at Santa Maria Novella train station in Florence. The hotel is literally a five minute walk from there. I was travelling alone and my room was quite small but it had a small balcony which made all the difference! I'm not the earliest riser and I don't really do breakfast so I can't comment on the spread they provide but judging by other reviews it seems a good breakfast. I had quite a busy stay as I booked a few tours. Francesca was unbelievably helpful when it came to helping me book the tours as she called the tour agency and arranged it all for me both times I wanted to book.  I visited Venice,…

title: Not a 4 star
review: Stayed fours days, and it has been a wonderful experience, clean, centrally located, and well kept. Our room was nice size, and bathroom very nice. Shower is small but this is most common in Europe, so no issues. A short walking distance to the train station to the north, and the river and walk to Ponte Vecchio to the south. Nice neighborhood, with many small restaurants and shops. We were pleasantly surprised that the street on Saturday was set up with small tents shops and markets stalls. We recommend highly. Moderately priced.

title: Perfect place to stay!
review: This hotel is certainly not a 4 star. Rooms are tiny. The shower is ridiculously small. Everything is cramped. Website makes it look great. Breakfast is not really breakfast. Pastry and coffee...no thanks. Will not recommend this place to anyone

title: Nice stay
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: GREAT LOCATION
review: Everything thing was very good location( it's both near the train station and city center) ,check in was fast and and the staff was nice and friendly,especially Francesca who helped us a lot Just we recomend to change or repair the hair dryer All in all we had a nice stay and we recomend this hotel for sure

title: Excellent location, great basic hotel
review: Dear nima r,  thank you so much for reviewing our hotel on Tripadvisor and for your compliments to our great  location and to our staff, especially our wonderful Francesca!  I apologize for the inconvenience with the hair dryer in your room that has now been solved.  If one day, you have the chance to come back to Firenze, I hope you will get in contact with us and book a room at Palazzo Ognissanti  again,  to give us the pleasure of serving you one more time  My warmest regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Nice hotel in a good location
review: Hotel was quiet descent Room size where good for two people. Nice location five minutes walk from train station. Good Indian restaurant, Ghandhi one of them few minutes walk Hotel staff were friendly Breakfast was decent, not much option for vegetarian people.

title: STAFF JUST SUPERB (5 STAR FOR THEM) Hotel good location AND Choices of restaurants all very close
review: Good morning sidharthb343,  I really would like to thank you for your nice review about Palazzo Ognissanti.  It's good you have appreciated the room size and furniture, the location ( close to the main monuments, to the fair center and to the train station) and the polite and kind attitude given to you by the members of our wonderful staff.  Thank you for the attention to our breakfast: it's a service that we continuously overlook trying to improve it and we accept favorably each suggestion about it.  If one day you decide to come back to Florence, you and your family will be our welcome guest; it will be a pleasure fro us to serve you again.  Warm regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: No complaints
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Staff was the best part!
review: We booked this hotel on line and it lived up to expectations. Our room was at the back so away from the street noise but the down side was that it had no window, just a skylight above the door. Everything else was as you would expect from a 4 star hotel. Fantastic breakfasts. Friendly and helpful reception. Spotlessly clean. No tea and coffee in room but I asked for a kettle and it was brought immediately with no charge. Perfect base for our short stay in Florence.

title: Friendly, in a residential area, walkable from the station. Great breakfast.
review: Hotel room was okay, but you must be on the courtyard side to avoid the noise from the street.   Rooms are good size with a comfortable bed.   The bathroom has all the amenities, however the shower is much to small.    The breakfast in the morning was very good.  The hotel staff were all dry nice especially Hanna & Francesca.   If you need to book excursions or make other reservations the front desk is very accommodating.

title: Good for a short break
review: We came here for a long weekend and were very happy with our stay here, starting with our arrival after a red eye flight, where we could have a coffee and a cornetto in the hall, which soothed us considerably. The room was comfortable and we could have stayed here for longer as there was enough space. Big choice for breakfast, with everything being refilled right up to the cut off time of 10 am. Proper cappuccino form the bar if you ask, not just filter coffe form the machine, wonderful salami,  fresh mozzarella etc etc.  Light sleepers shouild ask for a room at the back as there is rubbish collection early every morning and bottle banks opposite the hotel. It didn't bother us but can be a nuisance for some.  Would definitely come back here as it is just off the tourist centre…

title: Nice Location! Amazing and Helpful Staff members!
review: Hotel easily accessed from the railway station. Everything in the town is within 15 minutes walking. Near to the river which makes an excellent main pavement route to all the main attractions. Hotel rooms are clean and bright. Continental style breakfast more than sufficient. Good restaurants nearby and around the two for those other meals. Oh and so many ice cream shops (Italian style).

title: Organised & neat ....
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good but noisey
review: Hotel Ognissanti will turn out to be the place with all convenience at hand. The hotel is organised, neat, clean rooms and bathroom with right heating/AC. The staff is helpful and speaks fluent English. The breakfast was one of the best we found at Italy. We loved the spread !  The wifi was great. The hotel is situated very near to the Arno river and do not forget to take a walk along, during sunset. We also took a walk at night and the slow rippling of the river was music to our ears.  The room had a couple of Windows and sunbeam filtering in was a welcome sign ! The beds were comfortable and large and lighting in the room sufficient. Given an opportunity we will definitely return to Hotel Ognissanti to catch a movie playing right next door of the hotel.

title: 2 nights in Florence
review: Very Good hotel, clean and comfortable, excellent breakfast ,friendly staff,only thing what lets it down it is on a noisey street. Dustcarts arrive early,church bells start 7am prompt ambulance siren every few minutes.

title: Great Location
review: 10 mins walk from the train station with very friendly staff.  They arranged some tickets to one of the museums for us for the next day.  The rooms were a bit dated but we didn't go there to live in the rooms so no issue with them. Breakfast was a real treat - everything and everything - stuffed ourselves for the day. There wasn't any tea making in the rooms - you could buy downstairs but didn't bother. The hotel is very central - with every corner something new.  Lots of places to eat - not badly priced.  No dinner in the hotel. I would stay there again with no hesitation.

title: great value for the money
review: Stop # 2 on our EF Tour and we stayed at the Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti located in Florence, Italy.  The hotel was very clean, modern looking, good wi-fi service and the free breakfast was really good.  The room was spacious for a party of 3, it had a TV, safe, and the bathroom was big.  The closet had a full view mirror which I hadn't realized how much I missed until then.  We stayed on the 1st floor which wasn't noisy at all.  My only concern was that our window opened up to a patio which anyone could access, so leaving the window opened even for a few minutes wasn't really an option.  Hotel is centrally located so only about a 10-15 minute walk to all the shops, and restaurants, the square.

title: Good location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Very Good Hotel Near Santa Novell Train Station
review: It's good in location and friendly staff but room it's self was so small for me and also the breakfast space is a little bit small but generally its good in location so near to the river and to the centre of Florence

title: Barebones hotel in great location
review: The Hotel Palazzo Ogrssanti, a Best Western hotel, is a very nice hotel located near the main train station of Santa Novella in Florence. European Best Westerns are very nice hotels, and the buffet breakfast is excellent. The hotel is very close to car rental agencies, which we had planned to do, so this was another reason for choosing this location. There is a laundry mat right across the street, and very good restaurants in the neighborhood. The main tourist sites in Florence are not too far a walking distance from the hotel, The rooms are very nice, and the staff  is very professional.

title: ian & julie
review: Stayed for 3 days.  The room was an ok size with basic furnishings.  Wifi and location are this hotels strong points.  The bed is the hardest thing i have ever slept on besides the floor.   The pillows are so soft they might as well not be there.   They actually feel like a couple of cottonballs stuffed inside a pillowcase.   No extra pillows in the room either.  The staff were attentive when we talked to them. Breakfast was the usual italian offering with bacon and eggs as well.

title: BEST Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti
review: we spent 3 nights here, the staff were more than helpful, the rooms were not huge but comfortable and well serviced, the breakfast was what you expect, the train station is less than 10 minutes walk, there's a taxi rank across the street, as well as a laundromat and countless cafés and restaurants, the center of town is about 20 minutes , if you are able to not stop at every cafe /bar , it's italy after all

title: Good location but out of what I expected
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great hotel and amazing value
review: It's a 4 star hotel. Location is great. Rooms are clean however they are very basic. Bathroom had no toothpaste and tooth brush. Toilet was in front of the sink with very small room for legs. No any slippers or bathrobe available. Great variety of stuff as breakfast buffet. It's not a 4 star hotel.

title: Very average hotel
review: Hotel Ognissanti exceeded our expectations with immaculate rooms, great breakfast, warm staff that felt more like family, and Gianni and Valeria made our stay even more wonderful with daily tips for visiting sites, how to get there and special attention to all our needs!!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would love to return again. Within easy walking distance to the trains and heart of Florence and a few short blocks to the Arno River.

title: Would recommend to avoid this place
review: I visited Florence with my Wife and stayed here. Apart from the location, this hotel was very less to offer. Rooms are very very small but were equipped with basic amenities. The rooms were not even sound proof to say the least. All outside noise was coming inside. Furniture was old, breakfast buffet was very average. The staff was courteous. There was an Indian manager and he suggested me some good places in and around Florence. I would not recommend the hotel for staying with the family

title: Italy trip
review: Had stayed here for 3 nights with family and friends. Was very disappointing stay for numerous reasons. The hotel looks to be pretty but the rooms are very small. I was triple sharing the room (with my daughter) and it was a very small room. It will be a small room even for a couple! Insufficient lighting in the room.   During our stay we dropped something on the bed sheet/ blanket which made a couple of spots on the sheet (how big - not more than 1 mm each). The receptionist asked us 80 Euros for the bed sheet and said that the same needs to be thrown away since the marks were not going. Very honestly, those small spots (3 in total!!) were easily washable - I happen to get those every second day on my white work shirt and they go away. We told her we will wash it and give it…

title: Great value for money
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella.
