title: Not up to standards for a Best Western Hotel!
review: When my husband and I arrived at the hotel we were very dissapointed with the size of the room but they upgraded to a much bigger room on the top upon request. The staffs were excellent and really helpful. They arranged out tour tickets and taxis for trip to the shopping outlets. Chiara and all the receptionists were very helpful and kind. Breakfast was excellent. Our overall experience here was pleasant.

title: Excellent on all scores
review: We were very disappointed with this hotel.  Our room was very dated and dark.  The toilet would make a loud creak every time we sat down on it.  We felt very nervous and feared that it would come of the wall every time in use.  The hair dry was broken.  To be fair the receptionist did replace it, but the replacement hair dryer would give out a burnt smelt when in use.  And we were unable to access the WiFi from our room on the second floor. Would not recommend this hotel.

title: Very good price
review: We travelled to Italy with our grandaughter and booked into this hotel for 3 nights. Unfortunately our grandaughter was admitted to hospital and we stayed in the hotel for a further 6 nights. The staff in the hotel were absolutely fantastic, and a great support in what was a very difficult situation. They could not have been kinder or more helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The hotel itself was very comfortable, clean and the breakfast was great. It is situated in a very convenient location within walking distance of all the central attractions. I could not recommend this hotel enough and look forward to returning there at some time. Thank you to the manager and all the staff.

title: Great staff but rooms dormitory like
review: One night in november,  Very very good price. If u can, choose a room up on the 4th floor (because of the view)! In the pictures, part of my room and the view on the 4th floor. At the time of this review, i didn't try the breakfast yet Enjoy florence, the best city in the world

title: Not the best choice
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Nice Location
review: Stayed two night while visiting Florence. When we checked in, they gave us room 401, which felt like an attic. It was spacious, but no real windows and the floor was sloping. We asked to change to a different room. At least it had a window and the ceiling was not so low that we could touch it!  The room was clean and it had the amenities we needed, but the rooms could use a bit of updating.   The area around the hotel was a bit sketchy at night and there were loud voices outside very late at night. Also, there is a bottle recycling bin right outside and there were people depositing bags of glass bottles at all hours, which was really loud. It would help to keep the noise down, if the windows were updated to seal better and had double panes. The TV did not work very well, but we…

title: Good place to stay in Florence
review: The hotel was in a nice location - easy walking to most any attraction you'd like to see.  The room itself was on the cool side but perhaps the heat hadn't been turned on (it was fall).  Amenities were good - great breakfast, friendly staff.

title: Spacious room good location, nice breakfast
review: Excellent, good value hotel in the middle of Florence. Rooms are quite small, we had a room with a balcony at the front, but they do empty the bins in the street below at 5.00am! So light sleepers should request a room at the back. Gianni & his team looked after us very well.

title: Florence Hotel
review: Stayed here in Sept 2015 for two nights.  Room is spacious, large bathroom.  Very nice breakfast.  Located near train station with good restaurants and mini markets nearby.  Also short walking distance to the river.

title: Great place to stay
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Central location but noisy; great staff
review: Located just a couple blocks from the SMN Train station. The main sites are within walking too. Great staff - very helpful. Made reservations for us to bypass the long lines at Ufizzi Gallery and always gave great directions and information. Good breakfast provided. Rooms decent - a little noisy from the street. A real bonus is a laundromat right across the street. A very comfortable and clean and friendly place located very well.

title: A convenient hotel
review: We spent 3 nights in this hotel. The room was a decent size, bed was fine and breakfast was good.  That said, we had a ground floor room and it was noisy!  The street noise in the evening was disruptive to a good sleep.  Perhaps a room on another floor would have been quieter.   There was one staff member at the desk who was a great resource for dinner spots in our area. Her recommendations ensured we had delicious Tuscan meals. Only mediocre meal was the evening we didn't use her recommendation!

title: Wonderful experience
review: The staff at the hotel were extremely kind, friendly and professional. When we arrived around noon, our room wasn't ready, but quickly was afterward. They suggested where we should go for lunch then showed how to get to Ponte Vecchio and Santa Croche area. It's only a 10-15 walk and very easy to get to. A couple of gelato places along the way if you want to stop and indulge - we did! The hotel has a very good buffet breakfast, fresh bread, pastries, cheese fruit, juice, fresh coffee, eggs and bacon, toast. They will also make you a fresh cappuccino if you like. Great way to start the day. There is also a bar with coffee and pastries that you can help yourself to during the day. They were also kind enough to help us with our tour company as we were missed in the pick-up, and they…

title: Overated !
review: Walking distance from the train station, this hotel is as centrally located as it gets. The staff was incredibly friendly and made several arrangements for us (wine tasting in beautiful Tuscany and made dinner reservations for my wife and I). I really enjoyed my stay in Florence and the staff in this Best Western made it even better.   Rooms were clean and I couldn't be happier with my stay here. I highly recommend it.

title: Convenient and pleasurable
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Brilliant Situation in lovely city
review: Hotel is 200 metres from the Arno; about 800 from station where bus will drop you from Pisa airport. A ten minute stroll to Ponte Vecchio  and Uffizi. Room clean and cool; breakfast excellent (buffet) choice. Staff wonderful in every respect - friendly, helpful and always cheery and looking to make your stay even better. From the hotel if you take the road that runs one block parallel to the road by the Arno to go along to Uffizi, Ponte Vecchio etc, (go out hotel and turn left then left again - it's got shade which you might need,) it is full of good little shops (including antiques, souvenirs) and many small restaurants if you do not want to dine in the town squares. The nearest bridge across the Arno is Ponte Vespucci - go across and go one block beyond the river side road and…

title: Was not impressed
review: We stayed for 5 nights in this comfortable small hotel. Staff were so helpful booking opera tickets, advising re restaurants ,giving us useful directions .. The hotel is ideally located for all sight seeing. Breakfasts are  delicious too.

title: Steps Away from Florence's Historical Center
review: For a four star hotel I was honestly expecting better. The rooms were clean, but very uncomfortable. The beds felt like you were sleeping on concrete. The bathrooms very extremely small. Out of the three cities we stayed in, this hotel was definitely the least comfortable. I did not get much sleep needless to say. The staff was kind and the breakfast fulfilling.

title: Great on all Counts
review: Borgo Ognissanti is a tranquil place to stay while, at the same time, being walking-distance to Santa Maria Novella's train station and the piazza by the same name. From the hotel to Florence's historical center and Ponte Vecchio, it is a short, 10-to-15-minute walk. It has many, good, restaurant options on its street and all the way to Piazza della Repubblica and beyond—it is Florence, after all. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and recommend it to travelers. My room was spacious, comfortable and spotlessly clean, with everything working well. The wifi worked well in my room, too.

title: Good location but Con artists who wasted our limited time
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Room 218
review: We booked a triple room for 2 nights in this hotel and paid in full two and half months before our trip. Also we sent them an email in June asking them to confirm our booking. They did not reply. I had to call them and ask them to confirm it then they sent an email to confirm.  When we went there they said the room would be ready within one hour. The room was at the very top floor (5th) it was not a proper floor. It was actually an attic. The lift only operated up to the 4th floor and we had to climb this very narrow spiral stairs with our luggage. When we went in there it was like an oven because there was no air-conditioning and the sun was straight through the windows in to the room so we couldn't open the windows. It was not a proper room. The 3 single beds were facing three…

title: A good location, a nicely run hotel
review: Breakfast was included in the tariff and did not disappoint, a selection of cold and hot dishes served by courteous staff.   Parking is available about 150 metres from the hotel at €20 per day.  Nearby is a good selection if restaurants and the hotel is situated a pleasant stroll along the river from the old section of Florence.  Room 218 - Rather than being on the second floor it is along a corridor and then down a flight of stairs to the first floor.  No access by lift, so can be difficult with heavy suitcases.  The only saving grace was that the twin beds were well apart and did not require a rearrangement to get an acceptable degree of separation.  At €105.00  for a twin share room represented good value for 4 star hotel.

title: Horrible way to end off our stay in Italy.
review: We always felt welcome and taken care of at the hotel. It was clean, had a nice breakfast and was walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go in Florence. There were several bars and restaurants in the neighborhood that were also good. Parking was maybe 2 blocks away at a garage which also had great service. Wouldn't hesitate to come back here. Perfect for touring Firerenze.

title: Nice hotel with bad Internet
review: My husband and I booked our accommodation at the Best Western through an agent and it was paid in full two months prior to our trip. Upon arrival at the hotel, the receptionist notified us that they had only received our booking on that day due to system issues on their part and that they were already fully booked and had arranged a transfer to another hotel for us. I asked her if the other hotel was to the same standard and also within the same proximity of all the tourist sights as it was extremely hot on that day and we were not keen on walking far in the heat. Also we had chosen this hotel for its good location. She insisted it was the same standard and very close to everything and also said that the hotel would cover the cost of the taxi to the other hotel. Upon arrival at…

title: Poor AC, not great location, Free Wifi but slow
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review: The best western is right next to the train station which was really nice for us because we had a train to and from florence. You can just walk there with all your luggage it is so close. Only complaint is the poor AC/WIF compared to the other hotels we stayed at.

title: Ognissanti Neighborhood in Florence
review: The hotel is located only 5 min from the train station and is walking distance from the main attractions. Rooms were clean and breakfast was even better, with a wide selection of food. Staff were also very helpful. Highly recommend.

title: Highly recomended
review: The Hotel here has  very nice accomodations and the staffing is excellent. However the location is really ideal. For example its very close to the train station and that makes for an easy commute or taxi ride. Also, across the street was a pay laundry and nearly adjacent to that a tailor shop that does fix ups. A wonderful little grocery, really neat art store a jeweler with hand made silver and a terrific whole sale mens clothing store with easy access to the city make this place a real treasure.  The hotel was air conditioned and near a beautiful church and near the Westin.  I have travelled to florence often and this was another incredible experience.

title: Great hotel, walking distance to all the sites of the city
review: The rooms are really clean and big, the bathroom is really big. There is air conditioner, there is also free wifi but it was not really good. It only takes you 15 minutes to walk to the duomo, and its also near the train station. Breakfast was also good. I totally recommend it for a family or friends vacation.

title: Very enjoyable stay, professional service in a quality hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Sincere yet unfortunately very poor review.
review: A smaller hotel that offered quality service at a great rate. It's not an American Best Western with the larger rooms; expect slightly smaller than you might be used to if you are coming from America. But the people who helped us in the hotel were uniformly interested in us, pleasant, and very informative. Great service.

title: Mr
review: In the hospitality industry-particularly the hotel segment there is a term known as "moment of truth" The term refers to the action or actions performed by staff or management when a guest issue arises which requires a response. During my stay at this property the hotel itself experienced a moment of truth and the entire organizational structure from front office to ownership chose to ignore the needs of ALL guests staying on property. The entire hotel's HVAC or air conditioning system ceased to operate. I'm unsure how far in advance of my arrival the failure occurred-possibly the day of arrival. In fact, I'm in my hotel room on the second night of three writing this in total astonishment of the lack of response  by staff in mitigating this issue. I have heard first hand and…

title: A Small Hotel With 5 Star Service
review: 2 day stay in Florence.  Hotel was very convenient. The staff were excellent, suggesting tours and places to see and eat in town. Rooms bright and clean.  Breakfast was very impressive except the room was  hot.

title: Good room, clean, good breakfast, amazing location and friendly staff!
review: We couldn't find room at the Excelsior in Florence, turned out it was their Fashion Week and most hotel was booked.  We ended up at a small hotel recommended by our travel agent for its American standard even though it was just a Best Western.  The hotel is only one block away from the Excelsior hotel.  Coming from the Sofitel in Rome it was a little shock to our system at first.  We had a triple room which can hold up to three people for the two of us.  The room was small with a tiny shower (I'm only 93 lbs), but clean.  Their breakfast was just a simple Continental breakfast, but we only ate there once throughout our 5 nights stay so we don't know if they change out the food or not.  What made our stay much more pleasant was the front desk lady, Francesca, who was so sweet,…

title: Excellent Place to Stay in Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Very good service
review: This hotel is affordable, convenient to train station and to tourist sites.  Staff are excellent and very helpful.  Although the room was smaller than we expected, it was also the least expensive place we stayed (we also went to Venice and Rome), very clean and the breakfast was wonderful.  We would recommend staying at this hotel!

title: Great little hotel close to train station.
review: Good Hotel. Walking distance to train station. Great breakfast. White clean sheets and bathroom. VERY friendly staff. Francesca and Hanan in front desk were very helpful for maps, directions, and tickets. There is no coffee machine in the room but any time we ask for hot water in 2min they provided us with it. Also, Ioana in breakfast room was so sweet. Hotel is also located in walking distance to great restaurants, Coffee shops, shopping stores and most historical places. We got there early and in a short time our room was ready. Our room was facing a small garden upon our request and was quiet.

title: clean, good location
review: This hotel is an easy walk from the train station and is a charming little hotel with an excellent service staff. My room was a nice little single bed on the 2nd floor with a very nice little walk out balcony with table and chairs overlooking the street below - (Single bed because I was traveling solo). I would stay here again on my next return to Florence.

title: Thanks Francesca
review: Well priced, no frills hotel. It was clean, and the staff was friendly. Easy walk from the train station. Excellent breakfast. If we ever return to Florence, no reason not to go back to this location.

title: Conveniently Located, good hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Central location
review: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights. Included breakfast is excellent with sausages, eggs, deli, cheeses, juices, pastries, bread, cereal, yogurt, tea coffee. Walking distance to all sites and to both bus and railway stations. Staff was very helpful. Free Wi-Fi is not too bad. There was some intermittent disconnects. Speed was not too bad. We were able to Skype with family back home. Our room was very small so was the bathroom. Few neighborhood tips: If you enter of exit railway station with luggage, use the station's front exit where the taxis and buses stop to avoid the stairs at the side exit. It is a little longer walk to/from the hotel but it is worth.  If you happen to go to the Maso restaurant few steps to the right, do not order "mouth-watering risotto". It is not a…

title: Central location for any activity
review: Hotel is just 2 blocks from train station and just around the corner from car rental agencies, oh so convenient. Rooms are comfortable with good WiFi and great breakfast. We checked in early and staff went out of their way to make it work for us.

title: Good location for us.
review: Perfect location to get into the centre within no time. Also to the other side of the Arno river (Santo Spirito - nice for restaurants and nightlife) it is just a short walk. In fact we did not need any public transportation. Staff was very friendly and breakfast was above Italian average.Rooms are not decorated in Palazzo-style.

title: perfect for a city trip
review: I used reward points for this hotel and the location was close to main train station and river Arno. The hotel staff was amazing, very helpful and always had smiles on. They were a joy. The breakfast was good too. Hotel was clean and I found a great restaurant a few minutes away. It was two blocks to the Arno river and short walk from there to the ponte vecchio. It was a great experience and I would stay here again. My only miss was that our beds/room was more like a teens room. Not sure if it was cause we needed a twin or I was using rewards points but the one bed was a wooden box with a mattress on it and my moms bed was a pull out twin couch. That was not the most ideal part of it.

title: Nice place to stay in Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good Location and Comfortable Rooms
review: All aspects of the hotel were really nice, including the friendly, helpful staff, the cleanliness and location to attractions in Florence.  The only drawbacks were the mattresses were quite hard and it was noisy outside of the hotel in the early mornings.

title: Enjoyed our stay
review: This hotel is in a good location if you are arriving in Florence by train, as it is only a 5 minute walk from the station.  Our rooms were clean and comfortable, although a little small, although that is not unusual in Italy.  We had no problems with street noise at night although the street started to come alive around 6 am.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  We were 2 women traveling together and felt safe in this area, although we were home by 10 pm every night.  I would not suggest walking around the neighborhood late at night.

title: Francesca
review: Far enough away to leave the mobs behind but only 10 min walk to the attractions.  A short walk or cab ride from train station.  Clean and comfortable rooms with friendly staff.  Will be back as we found it a good value

title: Nightmare
review: Hotel was in a fabulous location, was comfortable with a great bed, towels, and shower; friendly staff; excellent breakfast; Entire staff was professional, pleasant, organized, attentive, competent, knowledgeable, efficient, and provided excellent suggestions to enhance our stay. Within walking distance of all the sights, the railroad station, the central bus station, good restaurants, and the Duomo. Without a doubt Francesca at the front desk was a veritable fount of excellent suggestions for tours, walking routes, the sights, museums, and other attractions.  monsoon7

title: Very good.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good 1 night stay
review: The hotel is very well located,near to Santa Maria Novella Train Station.It's easy to go walking to the atractions of this wonderfull city.The hotel is very clean.The breakfast is very good.All the people that works here is nice and makes everything even better.Thanks for you all.

title: Sleep on the street
review: My family of 3 stayed 1 night at the Best Western.  The location is good, a short walk from the train station and a block from the river.  The room was felt small with a fold-out bed for my son.  The bathroom was large by Italian standards.  Great water pressure.  Our room faced the main street, where we heard noise until later at night.    Check in was easy and the front desk clerk was extremely helpful, making a dinner reservation for us and arranging for a taxi at 5 am the next morning to take us to the airport.  They even asked if we would like to take a breakfast bag with us since we were leaving before breakfast was served.  Overall a pleasant stay for 1 night.

title: Barely enough, Needs and upgrade and better Management
review: My daughter and I stayed in this establishment last night  for 1 night to many. We checked in at 11am the room was not ready no problem. We left our luggage and went to explore what Florence had to offer.  Returned around 7.30 and given the key to to 15. Room 15 is ground floor with a frosted Window facing onto a well walked footpath and a traffic intersection also.  The noise of people and cars was dreadful.  The shower doors fall off the runners when you try to close them. I complained to the reception desk at 10pm the porter came to the room and said the noise is the ventilation! !!!. Reception said they had 1 room left on the 3rd floor I went to inspect the room with the porter the 3rd floor was actually the 3rd floor then up a narrow dangerous spiral staircase that our…

title: Room With A River View
review: This was probably the most disappointing hotel of the Best Western chain we faced in our 16 day Italy trip. The location is crap, there was always a loud crowd of guys outside the hotel drinking and talking at night. The Hotel is a block away from the river, but the ambiance is of a downtown market. Rooms are cramped, bathroom is tiny, and the facilities were moderate to poor. The first room we were put in had a horrible view outside with construction going on. There was barely any place around the bed and in the shower. For a stocky guy, I could barely fit in the shower without shattering the plastic wall. On request we were first told that all rooms are booked and then moved to a better room the next day. This room was better than the other one but nothing compared to the…

title: Great location and valu for money
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Location
review: I chose the Palazzo Ognissanti on the basis of other (mixed) reviews, but principally for its location. We were arriving at Pisa airport and coming into Florence by train - and the Ognissanti is less than five minutes walk from the Santa Maria Novella train station. It is also, very conveniently, about 100 metres from the River Arno and about 10 minutes from the Ponte Vecchio. Other main sightseeing spots such as the Duomo, Uffizi, Palazzo Vecchio etc are all equally easy to reach on foot. As for the hotel itself. It was clean, staff were very friendly, the room was average, as was the breakfast buffet.  Only slight disappointment was that the tiny bar was never open. It would have been nice to sit with a nightcap when we arrived back each night after dinner. But overall, I…

title: Good value, good location.
review: This hotel was by far the best place we stayed in during our two week stay in Italy.  Breakfast was delightful, rooms very pleasant, staff very helpful.  Conveniently located to the train station.  Much better than the Best Western across the street.

title: OK hotel...but rooms were very warm!
review: Hubby and I stayed in January 2015 for 2 nights. Lovely room with outside seating area for our use only (with furniture). Very central approx 7  minutes walk from Station. Lovely clean rooms with air conditioning. We were overlooking the street and Saturday night was abit noisy, but we slept with the window open and it was Saturday night in Florence! 1 very good trattoria 2 mins walk away, very good value set menu. Lovely hot and cold breakfast at the hotel. Good size working lifts. Pleasant and helpful staff. Would stay here again.

title: Perfect for a brief stay in Florence
review: We stayed here based on travel points, so it did not cost us anything.  The hotel is clean and near the Santa Marian Novella train station and easy to find.  We stayed 2 nights, and around 11 pm on the first night we asked to changed rooms as we were boiling...the room was so hot.  As we were on the main street, we could not open the window due to the noise level.  We were moved to another room, which was not as warm, but still warmer than we would have preferred, so we opened the window and slept with it open.  As this room was in the back, there was no noise at all. Bathroom was clean and well appointed, the bed was firm but acceptable.  The free breakfast included was decent: cold cuts, breads, cereals, pastries and coffee.  All was fresh. The location was within walking…

title: Inexpensive location versus expensive luxury?
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Noisy and basic
review: We stayed here for 6 nights, just before Xmas. It was selected for its proximity to everything we wanted to see without the claustrophobia and because it allowed savings to be spent in the centre of Florence. It was approx. 10-15 min nice walk into most areas (advise shoes without heels - cobbles and uneven paving/roads everywhere). The hotel itself was basic en suite with comfy beds and very helpful staff (we only used it for sleep, showers, storage and good continental breakfasts). The only downside was the noisy street it was on, guaranteed noise til gone 2am and then restart with the binmen or markets at 6ish. That said, drink plenty of lush wine during your rambles and you'll be fine. It suited our needs, all the staff were great and we had no complaints. Five min walk from…

title: Good Hotel near a Train Station
review: Let's start off by saying that I usually don't post reviews unless I'm exceptionally compelled to. Unfortunately this is one of those.  The hotel is basic- no frills, no charm, no luxury.   Many people commented about the location, however I was not impressed. The clientele hanging around the outside left me uncomfortable and wondering if I booked myself into a bad part of the city.  Lastly, the noise was insane. Not only could I hear my neighbors and the breathing from anyone in the hall, but you better pray that nobody honked their horn during the night because the noise is so loud it's like they are in bed with you!  Some better soundproofing is desperately needed.  If you live in the states, you can think of this hotel as being on-par with a comfort inn.  It's not a bad…

title: GOOD LOCATION AND FRIENDLY STAFF
review: I stayed in this hotel for three nights in April 2014.     ****Good****  Breakfast: I really like its breakfast buffet.  The quality was good and it provided many choices of food.  The buffet line was always refilled.   Service: It was very good.   The staffs were professional and helpful.  ****So-So****  Room: The room was OK.  It was clean and the room conditions were accepted.    However, the room temperature was quite hot for me when I first came in.   After I told the staffs, this problem was solved  Hotel Location: It was close to the main train station but not in the old town (not prime tourist area).  It was in the quiet area but there were a lot of shops, convenient stores, and restaurants.   However, most attraction sites were in the walking distance.      ****Can be…

title: Wonderful Experience...very well located
review: Dear Chanika,  it's always a pleasure when we get a good comment from a Senior reviewer as you are.  I'm particularly pleased about the praises to the buffet breakfast, the overall cleanliness and the competence of our staff: actually, these have been strong points of Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti all along.  As you properly indicated, another great competitive advantage of our hotel is its location: we are 300 metres far from Santa Maria Novella Station and  the main monuments like Ponte Vecchio or Duomo can be reached by foot in 10/15 minutes: obviously the context is not as quiet as if we were located in the Tuscan country.   Warm regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Not a 4 star Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Central
review: BEST WESTERN Palazzo Ognissanti Hotel is definitely not a 4 star hotel-more like a 3 star one. It is centrally located-about a10 minute walk from the train station and 15- 20 minute walk to the center. The room is very small and the configuration and the size of the bathroom makes it hard for you to do anything. Breakfast was average. The staff was friendly and helpful.    There are so many Best Western Hotels in Florence so if you take a taxi you should say Palazzo Ognissanti. All in all it was an average stay but definitely not a 4 star. It is a disappointing 4 star but a decent 3 star hotel.

title: Warm and noisy room
review: Near of city centre and monuments and S Maria Novelle Station. Good medium size room ,very quiet ( I ask for,when we booked), with everything working properly in room and toilet. Wifi speed fair and good breakfast. Friendly and eficient staff in check in and check out. Good place at medium price.

title: Not 4 star...do not book here if you expect the basics
review: In spite of having a very friendly staff, me and my wife were given a room very close to the reception (same level of the street) which was very noisy and (worst part) that was terribly warm. I asked three times for help, but nobody helped me with the problem (they switched off the AC). Even being almost winter, the room was at 30.o C almost and we had to sleep with the window that faces the street entirely open (more noise...).

title: 2nd time in Florence
review: We booked Best Westerns around Italy assuming there was a set standard for all of these..there is not. This one in Florence is terrible. We booked and paid for our three nights months before and when we arrived they put us in the street view room, even though we had requested months before, a quiet room. They did move us the next day, but they left our belongings in the unsecure reception area and we had to wait downstairs in what they call the guest area (computer is antique, doesnt even hold a memory card!) for over two hours to get into second room. No tea or coffee making facilities in the room. They did supply me with a jug etc on request but when we changed rooms we lost that. NO SERVICE from reception until around seven or so. I phoned and phoned and phoned, no one picked…

title: Perfect base for exploring Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: excellent
review: Friendly staff happy to advise on the best places to visit,room was spotlessly clean and made up each day. Breakfast was lovely, staff very helpful and excellent English spoken throughout the hotel. Many thanks for a lovely stay

title: perfect place to stay at florence
review: Good location and walking from train station. staff at front desk was very helpful with tips on place of interest and also helped us to make local calls to change airline reservation. Rooms size is very big. Business center has computer with next facility and they also provided us with chargers. Restaurants near by available. Rates bit on higher side

title: convenient to attractions
review: Already been here several times before. As always, very friendly, very comfortable and offering the best breakfast with respect to all other italians hotels of the same level and even higher. The location is perfect, very central but not too central and not chaotic. The hotel is accessible if you're arriving to Florence by car, as we usually do. Very high quality price ratio - highly recommended!

title: Great experience!
review: Clean. Inside looks new though building does not.  Lot of variety for breakfast.  Friendly receptionists.  Reasonably priced.  Bathroom small and little space between the shower and toilet.  Shower enclosure so small was bumping into it while showering.  But water pressure was good, with plenty of hot water.  Good points to location: in easy walking distance of Santa Maria Novella train station and easy walk to most attractions as is at edge of central portion of city.  Two short blocks to Arno River.  Bad points to location:  Lot of street traffic at night. We were on the first floor and at times it was a little noisy.  Worse, light in building across the street shone into our window.  My wife, who is a sound sleeper, did not mind at all.  I'm a light sleeper and I had some…

title: Travelling solo, decent, safe and inexpensive hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great stay!
review: Stayed 5 nights while in Florence in a single room.  The entire stay was under 500 euro, which for Florence is cheap.   The room was adequate but small with a single bed.  The bath was small and I could nearly fit into the shower!  But for the price and the amount of time I spent in the room (which was just to sleep), I was satisfied.  The morning breakfast is ok, but nothing special, enough to start your day.  The location is 3 blocks from the Santa Maria train station where most tours outside the city start (Cinque Terre, Tuscany) so the location is ideal and a 10 minute walk from the station.  The area around the hotel as a couple of good restaurants and the location is safe.  Highly recommend if traveling solo.

title: Great staff, value and location!!!
review: Dear PauloGofBo,  I would like to thank you very much for the good comment left here, especially for the nice words about our location, close to the train station and to the main monuments, ideal to discover our wonderful city.  Warm regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Could be better
review: It was our first visit to Florence. We found that the hotel was in a great location to see the sights, and was close to lots of bars and restaurants. Our room was not ready when we arrived, although the receptionist Chiara was most helpful, as she showed us on the map, places of interest to visit and recommended some lovely restaurants. Although the room was small, it was very clean and had toiletries. There was complementary tea and coffee and pastries in the reception area, which was very welcoming as we had been travelling from the early hours of the morning. Bin lorries can be heard, however this did not spoil our stay (we get bin lorries in England too!) Breakfast was more than adequate too! Many Thanks for a great stay!

title: Great location...right next to Arno
review: Yes Freddiege,  you hit the mark: our strategic position near to the station, Congress center  and the main city monuments like Duomo or Ponte Vecchio represents a great strength for Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti.  I'm proud of the words you spent about the overall cleaning, the Breakfast service and most of all about our clerks who are always willing to help our clients.  Many thanks from all of us and from Chiara, in particular!  Tea/Coffee facilities and pastries for free at the bar available for late Check-Out and early Check-In are a plus that we have the pleasure to offer to the guests: we believe that these little details can make the difference...  My warmest regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Great location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Forget the single room!!! AWFUL
review: We stayed at the Best western Ognissanti from July 20-23 2014 and were happy we selected this hotel. Hotel staff was superb and very helpful when we had a minor issue with our hotel the first night. We were moved to a "garden room view" for the remainder of our stay - fantastic room all because of the excellent hotel staff especially (Hannan- I think that's how she spells her name). The location of the hotel is within walking distance to all of the major sites in Florence ( we love to walk so maybe others may not think the same). We felt very safe at this hotel and found our room to be very clean. Breakfast was excellent and free wifi fantastic too. We are happy we chose this location as it is close enough to the train station and to the Florence sites.  Will definitely choose…

title: Kevin & Jane do Florence
review: Dear Angie 118,  It's good you have decided to share your good  impression about Palazzo Ognissanti with the Tripadvisor community.  Your comment made all of us happy: than you for empahzising the professionalism and cordiality of our  staff ( particular thanks from Hanan for the personal praises to her),  the rich and high - quality Breakfast and the central position of our hotel which is really close to the main monuments like Duomo and Ponte Vecchio.  Since you declare that you are willing to come back to Florence and stay at our hotel again, we look forward to receiving and serving you soon in teh next future!  Warm regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Totally worth it
review: On a business trip in FLR so went for a single room...BIG MISTAKE...  I received a room located in a mezzanine at the top of a spiral staircase (room 403) which was a single room. First of all, I noticed a strong smell of damp (possibly mixed with a cigarette smell too) which was very unpleasant. I called the reception straight away and asked them if they had another room - the hotel was full and apparently due to some thunderstorms in the afternoon, some rooms have been flooded!!! She asked if I wanted to go in another hotel but I declined the offer... The room itself was very small, small window - luckily I am not small as the window was pretty high up!!!, walls in need of some paint as marked, suitable bathroom ok (no shampoo?) but the worst was the tiny bed, not really a…

title: Certainly not a 4 stars hotel
review: Dear ebrousse,  let me start by thanking you for the nice words about the location of Palazzo Ognissanti ( near to the central station and close to the main city monuments and Fair Center ), but also for the praises to our employees: as you could see we are always well disposed towards our guests and we do our best to meet their needs.  I'm afraid if you didn't like the room assigned to you: that day when you checked in, that one was the last room available and the only solution for us to solve the inconvenience was offering you a room for free in another hotel of the same category and position located in the centre of the city : I'm really sorry you decided not to accept our proposal.  Best regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Excellent hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Frequent traveler and worst hotel experience ever
review: The staff at this hotel could not have been more helpful throughout our stay. The hotel was chosen based on its locality & initially the room booked for us was considered the best in the hotel. Whilst it was certainly a large room with sofas, large bathroom etc, the lack of a view or a window of any substance other than a couple of small skylights was off putting. Especially as there was a possibility Mum may have to spend some time in the hotel as she had recently fractured her foot. The hotel apologised & offered to move us to another room the next day. The alternative room was significantly smaller but a large window more than made up for it. Mum had ordered a mobility scooter through www.accesibleitaly.com which was to be delivered some time during our first afternoon. The…

title: Excellent economic hotel for exploring Florence
review: Auntywops,  your review was an authentic pleasure for us all: I have to tell you that receiving your compliments  regarding the location (in the city centre near to the station, Duomo and Uffizi), the rich and varied Breakfast and most of all about our  welcoming and helpful front desk ladies has been really good. And this is even more satisfactory for us considered that you are a top contributor on this social network!  I'm glad that you and your mother have enjoyed your stay in our wonderful city and in our hotel: I  wish that you will return in the near future and choose Palazzo Ognissanti again to stay, giving us the opportunity of serving you again.  Best wishes to your mum for a speedy recovery ...... warm regards!   Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Great Experience
review: While conveniently located, the hotel floor plan makes little sense. Several hotel rooms are on the ground floor with guest rooms on the street side.  The first night my husband and I as well as the couple we were traveling with occupied these rooms and we could literally here the conversations of people on the street outside our room window.  The second night we had rooms overlooking the garden, but both had problems with the air conditioning. The couple we were traveling with discovered the failure of the air conditioning as soon as they changed rooms and it was corrected before we returned from dinner.  My husband and I were not so lucky.  Our problem began after midnight when we were awakened by a sound very similar to a fire alarm.  After several minutes the screeching…

title: Very pleasant stay
review: Good morning tscollett,  thank you for the comment posted on Tripadvisor, and  for the praises to our location, a few metres far from Santa Maria Novella station and very close to the main city  monuments like Uffizi and Duomo.  I apologize to you for the inconvenience reported; most of all I'm extremely sorry that during the night you weren't able to call the reception to obtain instant help: this was due to the fact that  the number you were dialing ( 0 ) is not the one that connects with the front desk. Every hotel room is normally  provided with an instruciotn sheet with the useful numbers; I'm afraid that for some reason you couldn't find this form  in your room.  Our reception clerks are generally recognized to be smiling people working with a cordial attitude: I regret if you had a different impression about them.  I assure you that I 'm taking your observations in great consideration since each review contains elements that can help us to improve our job.  I renovate my apologies and wish you a good day.  Best regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Front Desk is 5-star service!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Lovely spot
review: I went on a European trip, staying in 5 different hotels (all 4-star or better) and this hotel was the BEST service I ever had, thanks to Francesca and the wonderful front desk staff. The front desk people are sincere, genuine people who always were helpful for restaurant tips, and navigating around the city! They are the kind of people everyone loves to be greeted by, and makes this place feel better than a 5-star hotel. The location of the hotel was great and Florence was my favourite city to visit, mostly thanks to the wonderful staff! Thank you Francesca for introducing your beautiful daughter, it was a nice family touch in a hotel-stay.  The room was quiet and internet was reliable. The room was plainly decorated but clean. The breakfast was good and didn't run out of food.…

title: repaid reservation ignored
review: Jus_fine,  Your wonderful review made me happy:  it was for me and for my staff a great start to our day!  I'm totally aware that the friendliness, kindness and professionalism of our clerks is one of our flegships and I'm pleased that  our reception staff has succeeded in conveying you a feeling of genuinity and familiarity ..many thanks for your kind praises in the name of Francesca ( and her little daughter.... ) and all the front desk ladies.  Tea/ coffee facilities and some tasty pastries left for free at the bar  for our guests are small details that, in our opinion can make the difference: I' glad you have appreciated this little sign. .  I wish you will come back to Florence in the near future: in this case it will be a great honour for us to have you amongst our guests and have the pleasure to serve you again.  My warmest regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Great stay!
review: We were very pleased with this hotel. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. We arrived and were told about local events (free museum night) and given lots of helpful tips for getting around.  The hotel was very central and it was only a 10-15 minute walk to most attractions. We were pleased with our room which was spotless and comfortable. We had requested a balcony and were accommodated. It was nice to be able to open our doors to enjoy the night air. We were also serenaded by a trumpet player one morning.  Breakfast was great with more variety than we would typically expect for a contiental breakfast.

title: Florence best
review: Dear sandandfi,  I really want to thank you for this kind review left on Tripadvisor; it was a real joy for us all to receive it.  It's good to receive praises to our trade-marks such as the rich and high quality Breakfast, the charming and professional  staff and of course  the hotel location, near to the train and bus station and to all the main tourist attractions  of our wonderful city, like Ponte Vecchio and Duomo.   We take in great esteem all the  requests made by our clients both before and after their check-in and when there is a particular need of the guest, we do our best to meet his requirements ( according  with the practical feasability of it and with  the hotel availability in that moment) : in your case it was a pleasure to assign to you a room with a balcony .  .....the morning serenade wasn't expected but it's nice that you liked it!  If in the future you come back to Florence and choose Palazzo Ognissanti to stay, it wil be a real honour for us to have you amongst our guests again .  Warm regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Amazing

title: Excellent location and value
review: Amazing trip to Florence. Hotel was really nice, receptionist at the front was really helpful. Rooms where small but tidy. Wifi excellent.  10 minute walk from everything. 5 minute walk from train station. We went to Pisa, very average place compared to florence.  Hotel recommended a restaurant called Il parione very close to hotel. Very lovely( make sure you sit down stairs!)   Great trip !

title: 40 th Anniversary Trip
review: Good Morning Arron27,  I'ts a real pleasure to know that we were able to provide you an amazing experience here in our magnificent city. Than you so much  for this nice comment and for the praises to our professional and helpful front desk  staff, to the WI-FI service and the hotel location, central and close to the station, the main monuments and the fair center. I really hope that you can recommend Palazzo Ognissanti to everyone: if your plans are to come back to Florence in the near future, I expect that you will  give us the opportunity of serving you again.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Good location and good service
review: The location attracted us as it was close to the train station and good stroll away from the main attractions. Upon arrival, we were impressed with the efficient and friendly staff. The room was tucked away on an upper floor and was a good size for the price - about £90.00 a night. The internet was easy to access and worked well in our location. The breakfast was very good with a wide selection of meats, breads, cereals fruit and drinks. There was even some bacon - something of a rarity in these parts - and better quality coffees could be requested from the staff. There's a reasonable mini-market over the road and a number of decent eateries in the same area. One noteworthy bonus was the ease with which we were granted an extended check out time to early afternoon which fit with…

title: Fantastic staff and location
review: Alan F,  yes, we are really proud of our breakfast which presents a great choice of high quality sweet and savoury products: we've worked hard on it and now we can say that  it gives to our hotel a great competitive advantage.  I'm glad that you have chosen Palazzo Ognissanti due to its strategic position near to the railway station, congress center and main monuments; but it's even more gratifying that during your stay you have appreciated the professionalism and kindness of our staff.  Thank you again for the nice words you spent about us: we look forward to having here  again as soon as it will be possible.  Warm regards.  GIanni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Not terrible... WORST!

title: Excellent hotel
review: 60s ambient room. Room 218 in other buildind afterwards firedoor. Very noisy window and we almost die frozen. This 4 stars is not an hotel.... IS A HOSTEL!!! Please recommend this hotel to your best enemies.

title: Excellent place to stay
review: Good afternoon Mr. David G.,  thank you for the comment left on Tripadvisor: it's very important for us to understand our guests' experiences to have the possibility to adjust our flaws and improve our appreciated hotel.  Best regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Great hotel with great customer service

title: Ideal location for leisure travellers
review: The hotel to be if you are in Florence less than 3 days. Its walking distance from the main train station. Its walking distance to literally everywhere in Florence. We hardly took any transport around. The ladies at the reception are more than willing to help with any queries including suggesting dining places and tours.

title: Good Location Hotel
review: Dear SreeGanesh,  it's been a pleasure to receive your comment on Tripadvisor.  Thank you so much especially  for the praises to our strategic position and to  the front desk staff, which are 2 strong points of Palazzo Ognissanti.  I wish to have you  within our guests in the near future to have the pleasure to serve you again.  Warm regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident manager Best western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Very classy and friendly
review: We stayed in the hotel for 3 days between 19-22 of November. We arrived from Nice by train. The location of the hotel is clearly is its USP. 5 mins stroll to Florence SMN station and SITA bus terminal. These travel options closeby helped us plan trips to more places around Florence. The hotel is also close to quite a few of the tourist hotspots.  Initially we were given a room on the ground floor which we requested the front desk staff to change. They promptly gave us a room on the higher floor. To our surprise the room was much bigger. Breakfast offered was among the best we had during our entire 15 day vacation in Europe.The staff at front desk were helpful in answering our queries. We had assumed a kettle would be available in our room for hot water. However, we were told its…

title: Not coming back
review: Dear vivek 1577,  believe me: it's always a great pleasure when I receive such reviews, because they make me realize that we have achieved what we were aiming for in a number of important areas.  Your focus on our staff's attitude towards the guests pleases me very much since it  emphasizes  that our daily efforts to meet our clients' needs is successful.  Thank you for the praises to our clerks, therefore, and also for the compliments to our high quality, rich Buffet Breakfast that you have ratedc as one of the best you have had during your trip in Europe.  I really hope that you can reccommend our strucutre to everyone....thank you again!  Warm regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Central hotel - near to railway station
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Wonderful Staff
review: We chose the hotel because it near to the railway station, and near to a care hire place.  We chose also a sightseeing tour for 12 hour, and it was a short walk in the morning to reach the coach.  The staff were very helpful to answer questions regarding different typical tourist questions.  Spending a week in Tuscany, raises some questions, and we got reasonable response to these. We recommend this hotel.

title: Best service and touristic informations!
review: Dear Kjell B,  it's nice to know that you have enjoyed your experience here with us.  You say that you have appreciated so much our strategic position; actually it is true that our hotel, which has seat in a beautiful nineteenth century palace recently renovated, is near to the  train station (300 metres only), to all the tourist attractions ( reachable by foot in 10/15 minutes) and to the fair center ( 700 metres).  Thank you also for the compliments to our staff!  I guess you can suggest our structure to everyone and wait for you again in the future .  Best regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Clean, Quiet, Comfortable
review: We were only in Firenza for a couple days and wanted to cram as much as we could into our short visit.  The staff was fantastic at booking us into places we wanted to go with just enough time to get from one place to another.  The breakfast buffet was probably the best we've ever had and that covers over 20 countries we've visited.  Aside from the baffling light switches (and I'm an architect!), this place is a real value.  Yes, the room was small but hey, this is Italy, the land where enclosed gocarts compete with trucks for space on the autostrada.

title: Good location
review: Good morning Rational...,  and thank you very much for sharing your experience at our hotel with the Tripadvisor community.  Wow....it's great to know you consider our breakfast the best one you've had over 20 countries you have visited:  this is a real honour for us and states again the absolute quality of our  rich and sorted Hot Buffet Breakfast   Thank you also for the praises to our staff, which is all along another great point of strenght of Palazzo Ognissanti.  I hope to see you soon again at our hotel: it would be a pleasure for us to serve you again.  Warm regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Small comfortable hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: good short stay
review: Room and bathroom was small but clean, air conditioning was very welcoming after visiting the city on a hot day. Breakfast was a selection of continental style, croissants, fruit, ham, cheese, cakes, toast. There was also a hot selection of scrambled egg bacon & sausage.  Although a fair walk into the centre of Florence it was nice to walk beside the river Arno, looking at the view.  Hotel ideally situated to the Santa Maria Novella station, which was ideal when we arrived by train, this was also the local bus station. There was no roof top terrace, which was disappointing. Make sure you save some euros at check out as the hotel have now introduced a Florence tax, which is 4 euros per person per night.

title: service oriented, nice staff
review: Dear TracyP63,  thank you so much for the kind words spent about us on Tripadvisor.  I know that our breakfast  is a "plus" of  our hotel and I'm  really proud of it, but of course  it's always a real pleasure to know that our guests rate highly this service.  Thank you also for the praises to the cleanlines and to our charming staff.  I guess you can suggest our hotel to everyone; most of all if you plan to return to Florence, remember that you  will always be welcome at Best Western Palazzo Ognissanti.  Warm regards.  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Really tiny rooms mar otherwise decent hotel
review: we got off the train and was a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Was greeted by front desk. Everything was excellent. We went to our rooms which where on the first floor. They where large enough and cool enough, but you are right on the street. You can see out if you stand on your toes. we would of liked a higher room but we where only there 2 nights. Internet did not work very well in these rooms. there is a laundry across the road so that was very helpful as we had losts to do. breakfast was god with a good assortment of items. The hotel is close enough to walk anywhere in Florence. There is so many great places to eat in this city that it was hard to decide where to go . food was good everywhere. The hotel was quiet even being on the street and front desk people where very…

title: Great location and staff
review: Hello adrienKitchener,  it was nice to receive your kind review with the  praises to the staff and the breakfast, which are actually two great highlights of our structure.  Thank you also for  emphasizing the position of the hotel which is situated in an old 19th century palace that has been fully renovated recently  and is near to the train station, the Ponte vecchio, Duomo and all the other city monuments.  I'm sorry if you had some inconveniences  with the WI-FI service (which is completely free of charge, in rooms and common areas) probably due to temporary problems to the internet connection in our area that now have been completely solved.  I wish to have you amongst our guests in the near future!  My best regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best West Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Very friendly and helpful staff; nice rooms.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Letdown
review: My friend and I, 2 active but "Senior" women, stayed here for several days.   The staff knew us and our room number the second time we came to the desk--and that includes the maids and the doorman.   They were always helpful with directions, making phone calls to make arrangements, guiding us to the best gelaterias and always greeted us warmly when we came in from a long day of sightseeing.   We always felt very safe.   The neighborhood is on the edge of the luxury area, so no mobs of tourists and good rates, and is only a couple of blocks from the river and surrounded by restaurants and cafes.     It was very hot during our visit and the air conditioning in the room was totally effective.  Everything in the room and bathroom worked (well, we didn't even turn on the TV) and the…

title: An 4 star hotel with rooms in ground floor!!
review: Dear Sherrie D,  I was glad to receive your kind review especially for the nice words you spent about our staff, in particular the front desk clerks, who are always available to give directions or make reservations to our guests helping them  to have a really pleasant stay in our beautiful city.   Thank you also for pointing out the peculiarity  of our great  location, near to Ponte Vecchio, the  Duomo and the main train station but at the same time in a quite position far from the noise and confusion.   When you come back to Florence, Sherrie D,  you will Always be  welcome here  at Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti.  Kind regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Great Service and nice place to stay.
review: Arr late was told I would be given d key for my rm later, this never happened ,for security reasons I didn't feel at all at ease with the situation asked to speak to the manager and 3 members of the staff said he would be on duty the following day which was another lie...having not slept all nt considering I had been traveling all day I decided to look for another accomodation rephnoned hotel  was offered a box rm !gave a no to be contacted by the manager still till today after 4 days he seems to be trying to avoid the issue which doesnt say much for a hotel belonging to a big chain of which I have been a loyal member for many years .This is definitely not a 4 star hotel,  outside very deceptive, porter wearing jeans and trainers and no one seems to take accountability for what…

title: best western ognissanti Firenze italy
review: Dear csant,  after receiving your review, I would like to clarify some aspects of what actually happened during your short stay.  Upon your arrival we realized that the key of the room that had been assigned to you  was missing; that's why we solved the inconvenience by having the door of your room opened with a passpartout by our porter each time you needed it. Once in your room you could have locked the room from the inside and be completely safe.  The following day we would have changed your room because this change could not be made on the spot since the  night of your arrival we were fully booked   We find this a regular procedure in  such exceptional  cases and we don't find anything scandalous about it.  This said, we would like to point out your uncivil and totally unacceptabble  reaction towards all our personnel . You have heavily offended and threatened the girl at the reception and the night porters with words that cannot be repeated in this social network: the normal procedure would have been to call the police because of your  greatly aggressive behaviour  (screaming, yelling, offending everyone....).  In all these years of hotellerie I had never experienced such an unspeakable attitude: that's the reason why I have not contacted you.  Regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Poor choice
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Certain 5 star elements but other let downs
review: Ognissanti hotel is very expensive Euros 171 including taxes...very poor rooms at the most 2 stars. The room floor tiles are outdoor type. The bed is not comfortable. The room was very hot when we arrived and we could not turn on the AC finally someone arrived when called and explained that we AC is set to 25C and could not be lower. the electric panel cove was falling off the wall....the wall paint flat white and not too clean. the room was tiny, the safe was not working we where offered to use the safe at the reception. Stay away there is much better place to stay.

title: Most Enjoyable Stay
review: Dear Worldtrotter2009,  it seems you didn't like us so much.......  I'm sorry if you had some inconveniences with the A/C and the safety box in your room, that are now completely solved.  I'm sure that  our reception staff  (trained to help our  guests for all their needs)  have offered you the chanche of changing the room since you told them about those problems : I'm afraid you have decided not to make the shift .  As per the other things, I just can state the obvious: Bw Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti is definetely a  Four Stars Hotel recognized by law and by Best Western which every year carries out a severe Quality Assesment Report on each Hotel member.  About the price, our  daily rates are  completely within  the average of the prices made by 4 Stars Hotels in the centre of Florence.  I wish you a good day.  Best regards,  Gianni  Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Great Stay
review: The hotel has a lot of character from the outside, it fits in with the surrounding historical area.  Bare in mind that our first choice hotel was the Best Western over the road which was the Grand Hotel Adriatico, unfortunately that was not available on all the days we wanted to stay so we had to opt for the lower rated Palazzo Ognissanti.  The Grand Hotel Adriatico was much more modern from the outside so had less character, but we did visit the Adriatico and the interior was much better and you could see that it was probably a better quality hotel than the Ognissanti.  However the Ognissanti has a much more relaxed, less business like feel to it.  The staff are very friendly and relaxed (less formal than the Adriatico staff).  There are certain elements about the hotel that…

title: Enjoyable stay
review: Hi Syio,  It was a pleasure for me to receive your nice comment regarding our structure on Tripadvisor . Wow: we got 5 stars!!! 5 Stars rating for our cleaning and  reception staff is  a great praise and of course  I'm  really proud of it.....I'm particularly glad that we succeed in getting this kind of "relaxed and informal" atmosphere across our guests, because this is exactly what we try to do with our daily work.  I'm sorry you if had a different feeling about the breakfast since this is usually one of the best aspects of our service (as you can understand by reading the other reviews): our items  are fresh, high quality  and varied and the service is normally  friendly and polite.   With my warmest regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Nice Location & helpful staff
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella.
