title: Definitely not a 4 star hotel but ok experience
review: The hotel is just 5min walk from SMN station. The room is clean & nice but is a bit noisy as we stay in ground floor as outside ppl passby. The hotel breakfast in good as there are few selection. In addition, the staff is helpful but clumsy. We reach early to check in but since room is not available we need to drop our luggage! After that, the staff hand us a map & show us all the attraction. After 2 hours tour, we head back hotel & the hotel mix up our luggage with other customer. This is terrible

title: Very good location
review: My dear AcuraMelody,  first of all I would like to thank you for the nice comments regarding our breakfast and the overall cleanliness.  Our front desk clerks are all  generally recognized to be very pleasant and self-confident and I'm sorry if you had a different feeling.  As per regards to the impression you had about your luggages, I want to reassure you about this point: we simply store our guests' suitcases in a locked up deposit where  every baggage is marked with  its own label to recognize it from the others .  With my best regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Great hotel!
review: This is definitely not a 4 star hotel, more like 3 star.  Overall the stay was fine but there are things which could be improved.  The toilet flush did not work properly in our room and we had to call someone everytime until we were able to fix it ourselves.  The room itself is ok in terms of size etc.  but the TV is terrible and doesn't work properly.  On the plus side, everything was really clean and well kept.  The breakfast options are good, typical continental fare.  The staff are all nice and helpful.  Location is great, pretty central and walking distance to major sights.

title: Breakfast!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Mixed review for this hotel
review: We had a hard time finding the hotel. What you do is, when you get out of the SMN station, look for the brasserie Deanna, turn right on that street, cross 2 streets (this is the direction to the Arno River. When you see a restaurant with glass "walls" on the left corner, walk straight and will find the hotel on that side of the street.  We had to leave early on our last day and the hotel staff was nice enough to give us packed breakfasts (toasts and juice). *No air conditioner during spring season.  *Nice free coffee and cocktails (6pm) at the lounge area.

title: good location near the station, helpful check in staff
review: Dear lovetripsdd,  thank you very much for the nice review which points out once more  the great quality of our breakfast and also ....  gives free and affordable  directions to reach our hotel !  Kind regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: It does the job!
review: First the pros:  the location is very handy to the train station and sites.  Price is very good for a 4 star hotel.  Staff are very efficient, friendly, and provide great customer service.  The hotel works very hard to maintain this older building - we couldn't get over the work being done to clean and polish the floors.  The room was spotless.  Breakfast is without doubt the best we have had in Europe. Next the cons:  I'm sure this has absolutely nothing to do with the hotel itself, but there was a strong smell of sewer gas in the area.  Room 307 has a very nice small patio, but the smell made it uncomfortable to sit outside for long, or to leave the bedroom window open.  (Either that, or it's the garbage dumpsters right outside.)  The room and bathroom were the smallest I have…

title: Italy Trip
review: Dear 2islandhoppers,  it's wonderful to know that the breakfast you had at Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti was the best one during all your tour to Europe!  Breakfast, along with cleanliness and staff attitude are our great points of strength and I'm pleased that you have  perceived it during your stay and highlighted it in your comment.  The  smell you refer to was actually due to a damage in a gas pipe located under the street outside the Hotel place that has now been fixed.  The difficulty in adjusting the temperature inside the  room was due to a problem in the building authomation system which is being solved.  My best regards,  Giani Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Florence Delight
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Good location, impressive entrance only let down by inefficient reception staff
review: The stay was for only two nights, but the hotel itself was a treasure.  Front desk staff went out of their way to be helpful as did the young man who had to manage my luggage up to, and down, from the third floor.  I often use Best Western and this one was ideally located within walking distance of the train station as I did all my European travel by train and most of the city centre.   Room was tastefully decorated with a very well appointed bathroom.  Breakfast was plentiful and good selection of items.  This hotel would be a definite stay again for me.

title: Excellent hotel and value for money
review: Dear jmcneil31,  I'm very pleased of having received your nice review.  I would like to thank you  in the name of all our clerks, whose daily work and dedication makes our hotel  greatly appreciated by our clients.  Thank you  for the compliments to our breakfast too!  If in the future, if you plan to come back to Florence, we will be glad to have you  amongst our guests again.  Warm regards.  Gianni Andreucci  Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Great stay over New Year
review: The hotel itself was perfect for us and we often use Best Western on our travels.  Big problem with booking my visit to Academy Gallery- I had booked on line thru pocket guide who informed me they would send link by email or fax to hotel. For the next 2days I presented myself to reception who told me nothing had arrived... on the actual day of excursion (also last day in Florence) I was really upset as again on phoning down was told there was no news - meanwhile I had been emailing travel company who put me in touch directly to their agent. On checking my inbox for that morning I found a letter from them informing me they HAD sent link half an hour after making booking 2days previously!!  I naturally was extremely angry when I spoke to the very red-faced receptionist who on…

title: Good location and clean rooms...
review: Dear Caminix,  first of all I would like to thank you for the review.  A circumstance like the one you report is very unusual in our hotel since all of our frront desk clerks are very careful and take in great consideration our guests' needs: anyway it's clear we've made an error and therefore I strongly apologize to you for the inconvenience happened due to our mistake.  I'm glad that at the end you were able to make your excusrsion anyway.  Best regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Centrally Located, Delicious Breakfast, Great Stay
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great Hotel business and  vacation
review: I was in Florence for a few days, and loved this hotel. The hotel is centrally located so you can walk everywhere. The front desk was very helpful, and the breakfast was delicious.   The hotel has some great information on tours. The best tour I took was the wine tour. I believe it was Chianti Classico.

title: okay, have moderate expectations
review: Dear Italy2017,  thank you so much for having posted this nice comment on Tripadvisor , particularly for the compliments addressed  to our staff and to the breakfast.   Warm regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palzzzo Ognissanti

title: Ok, but not what one would be expecting from a 4 stars hotel
review: I have stayed at the Best Western Palazzo Ognissanti Hotel in Florence many times in the past few yeas.  I must say that even though I am now a "freqeuent" guest, my opinion of the Hotel and the staff has not changed from the time I first stayed in Florence.   The front desk is always accomodating and helpful, and the small changes that have been made to make everyones stay more pleasant have been welcome, but not needed enhancements. The rooms are small for an American's standards, but certainly large enough for 2 people and not too dissimilar from other rooms in Italian cities. If you are looking for a friendly staff environmnet without the hassle of the large hotels, this is the place to stay in Florence whether this is a return visit to Florence or your first trip.

title: Convenient location near main train station
review: Thank you so much gaweba; your review is one of the nicest we have ever received .  It is very important for us, since it  shows that the efforts we have made over the years  to improve our efficiency and the hotel  overall quality have been successful.  As you properly noticed, in 2012 we have made several changes to our services by improving our Breakfast  (which now presents, amongst the other  things, eggs, bacon, sausages, a large assortment of Tuscan salami and cheeses, muffins, hand-made cakes and fresh  high quality  pastries).  For those clients who make an early check-in or late  check-out, we offer at our bar  some of the above breakfast  items  (tea, coffee and pastries), and every night from 6.30 to 22.30 we prepare an aperitif.   Free internet access is provided in the whole hotel.  I hope to see you in our hotel soon, gaweba:  you will always be welcome here!  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Very Good at the price point
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: A GOOD PLACE TO STAY IN FIRENZE
review: This is a well located hotel catering mainly to domestic Italian tourists. It really is a find for the foreign tourist and it is hard to pick anything to complain about. I found it to be great value and a good all round performer. It is close to the train and the river and the hop on hop off bus. The Westin hotel - three times more expensive - is two minutes away. It is very easy to do the Pisa day trip from here. Just walk 5 minutes to the train station and use the friendly ticket booth to give you tickets on the spot: it is totally a waste of time to queue up to buy a ticket from the service counter. The booths are faster and easer. The trains go on a regular basis. Do not waste your money on first class - it is unnecessary. The train takes an hour each way (7.80 euros per…

title: See your room before signing the register
review: Dear lex_loci_david,  let me thank you in the name of the hotel for the beautiful review you left us and for  the nice words you spent for our clerks : actually it's true that we have a skillful and  multilingual staff speaking different  languages!  I'm really  glad you  enjoyed your stay and  I wait for you or your friends to stay again with us soon.  I'm also taking good note of your suggestions in order to improve our services.  With my warmest regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: just ok
review: After some bad experiences in Firenze, finally I have found the right place to spend a night in Firenze. I arrived at Santa Maria Novella Railway Station at around 2200 hours and the Hotel is just 500 meters far from the rail station. But cause a strong rainfall we took a Taxi, just 10 Euro the cost for 2 people and 3 baggages. We reserved the room via internet so at arrival at Hotel we just waited 5 minutes to get our room. Hotel has 3 floors and 2 elevators. To enter in the room you have a magnetic key. Good room and very clean. Good bath room with shower working perfectly. We pay 90 Euro for one night. reservation online done in september 2012. The Hotel is quite near to Arno river and also not far from Central Bus station near Rail Station. Television set working OK and with…

title: Good location and nice size room.
review: Well playdx,  what can I say after receiving such a kind review from you ?Thank you very much for having discovered us and for your pleasant words!  I wish you will reccommend our hotel to whom, amogst your  friends, wants to visit our wonderful city.  Warm regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager Best Western Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Quiet Hotel in a great location!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Decent Stay - Close to the Train Terminal
review: Close to the train station, this quiet and comfortable hotel also exceeded my expectations while my husband and I vacationed in Florence. The front desk was kind and very helpful. The atmosphere is elegant especially in the lounge where there were lit candles and appetizers every night. It looked very pretty. Breakfast was plentiful although very different from what is usually served in the states, there were good choices available for those who are not into eating cold cuts and cheeses. Very walkable to all the main tourist areas in Florence. It was very clean as well. The bathroom had a shower with a door on it! Big plus! Overall very enjoyable.

title: Great location, nice staff
review: We were given the "Loft" room (401) and it was very spacious yet odd at the same time.  The roof was slanted so anyone over 6 feet would have difficulties walking around.  Also, the room didn't have any over head lights and only had 2 "Sky lights" with shutters.  The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the free Wifi was excellent!  The only thing for those travelling in the summer was that our room had a very loud A/C that the previous guest had shut off from the breaker panel.

title: Near car rentals
review: The room was small but clean and the wifi worked well. The breakfast had the best variety of any we came across in a three week stay in Italy. The real highlight, though, was the location -- very close to the Arno River, Ponte Vecchio, the central market, the train and bus stations, and the other sights of Florence. Good restaurant nearby: Ma So.

title: very hot summer weekend in Florenece in small bur very nice hotel Palazzo Ognissanti
review: Dear Sirs,  What  a pleasure to read your review and the positive comments, particularly those regarding our breakfast: as a matter of fact this item has been improved in this last year and it is now one of our distinguishing features.  Thank you so much!  Kind regards,  Gianni Andreucci Resident Manager BW Hotel Palazzo Ognissanti

title: Good Location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Do you expect to be provided with a bed?
review: Good location for the city centre and train station which is 10 mins walk. The staff were all very friendly and helpful despite our very early check in from a overnight train from Munich. Breakfast is excellent, offering a good selection buffet style. Our room was quite large with air con, a mini-bar and a good bathroom. WIFI connection was intermittent and only really worked in reception, but the connection was not fast.

title: The worst ever
review: On the first night I arrived at midnight, so it would not have been safe or sensible for me (as a woman travelling alone) to have left the hotel immediately, though that is what I wanted to do when I saw the room I had been assigned: Room 403. There was no bed. Instead, there was a shelf extending from the wall, on which had been placed 4 camping mats, stacked on top of each other and covered over with a sheet. The 4 mats were not connected to each other, and they had not been designed to fit together; they were not in any sense a mattress. The result was a rock-hard surface that was neither flat nor even; the stack sloped towards the floor so that lying down on it felt precarious. I have lower back problems connected with major surgery a few years ago, so when I woke up after…

title: Great location , friendly staff
review: We reserved & paid fully for the 3 nights 2 months ahead.Yet when we arrived at the hotel, the receptionist heard our last name, didn't even bother to check into computer & told us there were no rooms & they would move us to another hotel...We said we would file complaint to Expedia, not in 2 minutes, the manager immediately said the room available... What kind of hotel?  It is just a kind of tactic to move you to a cheaper hotel. About the room, a pain to take shower with its sudden cold/hot water.The American hotel chain is only interested in buying cheap local hotels but not interested to upgrade them.(Same for Hilton too.) Only Ramada is reliable.

title: Accommodating
review: Stayed for 5 nights - great location close to Railway Station and most attractions within 10-15 minute walking distance. Staff very polite and helpful. Breakfasts were very good with great choice. Room was clean albeit a little small and air con was very noisy. Good value for money in a beautiful city.

title: Definitely NOT a 4 star
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: You could choose a better place!
review: Stayed here for four nights in late June. A/C not able to cool the room, which was on the ground floor (I totally agree with a previous reviewer that the street noise is very bad). NOT HOT WATER, although the staff made attempts to 'fix' it. With the high temps of the days, I still could not make myself get into a freezing cold shower to cool off. The room was extremely musty, and if we had to stay another night, we would have asked for another room. However, from what I've just read, it sounds like there aren't any better ones.....Breakfast was definitely the best thing about staying here. WiFI inconsistently available. Location was fair. There are plenty of other hotels in Florence to choose from. I suggest finding one.

title: Great service
review: Stayed 3 nights in June.    Not a 4 star hotel as advertised.  What is good about this hotel: the breakfast, good elevator, room was good size (european standard) and 5 minutes from the train station.  What we did not like:  no hot water and no pressure in the shower;  Wifi was not working and hotel could not fix it.  All in all, it is a run of the mill hotel.  We would not go back – lot’s of other hotels close by.

title: Not 4 star but staff excellent
review: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in May.  A train strike had prevented me from continuing my journey.  The greeting was friendly and helpful on my arrival and continued during my stay. The reception staff provided assistance and advice with my disrupted travel arrangements.  My first night was in a small but quite adequate single room and the second in a spacious double.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  The location is good, close to railway station and not too far from Pont Vecchio and Florence tourist sites.  Wifi was much appreciated.  Breakfast  was good.

title: rooms and service
review: I stayed end of May 2012 for 8 nights.  The first room I was given was extremely small with a tiny sigle bed,  so asked for another room.  The second room was on the 4th floor, an attic but bigger so I accepted.  The location is great near everything, the reception staff were very friendly and most helpful, the breakfast was also excellent.  Overall a pleasant stay but again definately not 4 star.

title: Definitely not a Palazzo - certainly not FourStar!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Actually 3 stars
review: Stayed five nights. Tiny double room, a/con not controllable, fridge useless and not restocked, very little clothes storage, lack of hangers, tv hard to operate. Breakfast ok. Clean.  Staff try to help but seem a bit lost. Disappointing.

title: Small rooms, clean, neat, good location
review: As i like my luxury ( clean bath-shower-toilet-bed) i opted for a 4 star hotel for my stay i Florence. This hotel has recently been refurbished and you can clearly see that. The staff are very helpful and accomodating, which makes up for most of the stuff lacking. The room was small with a single window which looked out over Florences rooftops. The bathroom was new and functioning very well. Just the bed was horrible to sleep in. I arrived on a sunday and it seems in Italy nothing gets done on that day. The temp was 30C....and the AC was not functioning..sleeping at night was impossible in that heat. A call to the reception and they turned the temp down.....i did not notice it at all. Also my safebox was not working. The next day, i got a new electronic key and everything was…

title: Nice and small
review: Stayed in the hotel with a group, hotel had fairly small rooms, but good elevators, and everything was clean and neat.  My room had a balcony and great blinds and curtains that completely blocked sunlight.  Breakfast was fabulous, much more extensive than I expected.  It even had scrambled eggs, fresh fruit, and yogurt, in addition to meat, cheese, and pastries.  Hotel provided free wifi, though signal strength was pretty weak in my room, better in the lobby.

title: Not such a great choice
review: I enjoyed my stay here - small room (I was traveling alone, so one twin bed) with TV, wifi, pre-loaded mini fridge, small bathroom with shower, closet, and suitcase stand. Window opened onto the street - love that! - and the shutters allowed for total darkness at night.  Positives: great for what I needed: a place to sleep and crash after too much sightseeing; breakfast is phenomenal - huge variety of food buffet-style, with eggs, meats, cheeses, juices, coffee, pastries, jam/nutella/spread, mini muffins, toast, cereal, yogurt (!!); staff was friendly and helpful.  Negatives: thin walls and wi-fi only worked 50% of the time, plus taxes to pay at check-out.  In all, positives outweigh the negatives and I really enjoyed my stay!

title: Please read before booking!!! - definitely the worst '4 star' hotel I have ever stayed in!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Very nice hotel with excelent staff
review: This is not a 4 star hotel despite it being advertised and priced as such. Upon arriving we were assigned a ground floor room facing a noisy street. Supposedly the wooden panels on the windows provide sound insulation but I am not exaggerating - you can carry a conversation with someone outside from our room!  Don't expect to get a good night's sleep!  Things that do not work or do not work as expected - the air conditioning is for the whole hotel and the thermostat in the room does nothing - the toilet leaks constantly - the water pressure in the shower is so low that it would take a bald man 30 mins to wash his hair - the volume on the tv can't be increased past a setting of 20 out of a possible 100 (so you can't drown out the noise from outside) - and the sink plugging…

title: You were warned!
review: Nice BW hotel with large rooms and excellent breakfast. Location is good enough. Price of room was in accordance with Firenze costs. Staff very helpful and courteous, especially Valeria. They help us with everithing including good recomendation and ordering places in restaurants and were flexible with check-in and check-out time. Definetelly, will stay in this hotel during my next stay in Firenze and will recommend it to my friends.

title: Basic
review: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights, starting on March 29th. I prepaid - the only reason I didn't move on. Excellent breakfast, good location and fast wifi. And that's all.  As shown in the attached pics, extremely small and badly furnished room.  Where are you supposed to keep your clothes? Certainly not in such a huge closet!  Our room faced the street: till midnight there is  (every night!) a bunch of men drinking, yelling, sometimes arguing - you won't sleep. At 6 am a truck loads tand empties the garbage receptacles located in front of the hotel. Unless you are on pills or passed out, prepare for an early  awakening! The coffemaker was delivered on request - as advertised. And had to be changed because it wasn't working.   The cups weren't  cleaned - maybe I should request…

title: Good price for basic room
review: Close to the "centro storico".Not too far from the train station. Basic rooms.

title: the location is close to the train station but service is not very good
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Reasonable hotel
review: The hotel has very high technology that the electricity will turn off by itself every 5 minutes. If you turned the light/ TV on, they will be turned off by itself after 5 minutes. We rang the reception to get someone to help us but they only come after a few phone calls from us. They finally fixed by turning the electricity from AUTO (auto turn off to save energy??) to manual.   We left our luggage at the reception upon checkout. When we get back to the hotel to collect our luggage, our number lock has been 'touched'. We set a certain number on the number lock but the number has been changed- proved that the staff in the hotel was trying to unlock our luggage. Very rude and dishonest staff at this hotel. Be careful if you left your luggage at the hotel. Don't leave any valuable…

title: Good Hotel ! Good Location !
review: An ok hotel that served it's purpose, not too far from the beauty of Florence and the train station even if there is a short maze of roads to navigate to reach the hotel. The expected standard you would expect from a Best Western at a reasonable cost, a lack of any city view makes it a bit dull but a functional hotel.

title: Average- No AC from October...
review: Nice BW hotel with large rooms and excellent breakfast. Location is good as you are only a few minutes walk from Centro Storico. Price of room was in accordance with Firenze costs and only complaint was street was noisy due to recycling bins that were dumped every day. My advice get a room away from street. Staff very helpful and courteous and I would stay again.

title: Good hotel
review: Visited October 2011. We booked a room for 3 people and received a small room with a squeaking toilet. Really couldn't move much when a 3rd bed was put in.  The AC didn't work and it was really hot even at night. When i went to check at reception i was told that the AC in the building has been shut down for winter time and she can get me a fan for the room if i wish. This is a very old European tradition to play with the central heat/AC in the building and not allow the guest to have the temp he prefers at his room. Anyway, when i called 30 min. later for a fan reception had no idea what i was talking about and suggested opening a window...hardly slept with all the mosquitoes and moved to a different hotel the next day. Room itself is outdated but works and breakfast was Ok. The…

title: Outstanding
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Useful location
review: Great hotel. A four stars no doubt. We prepaid the room and arrived very late. Lady from front desk (Giada,very nice girl) gave us room keys, knew that we were tired and did not delay at all checkin. Breakfast was good , fresh products and attentive waiters. Rooms we a little bit small but hey, its italy!

title: Decent
review: Trip business to Florence and I slept at Palazzo Ognissanti Hotel. Price was more than ok for Florence (92,00 euro with breakfst and parking included). Room was clean and tiny, quite wide and bathroom was clean and full equipped. Nothing special anyway. Most important plus for this Hotel is however its location: 10 minutes walking distance from Duomo, Ponte Vecchio, Piazza della Signoria, etc. Only negative thing was a noise made by elevator as my room was wall to wall with it.

title: just like a John Malkovich movie
review: I spent 3 nights in this motel in October. Nothing to rave about, nothing to really complain about. The room and bathroom were just "ok." Nothing special. I had a room which faced out onto the main street, which, in my opinion, was/is a bad idea. The hotel to me, was hot and I am a "hot" sleeper. So, generally I sleep with windows open (I am in Switzerland now, and I have the windows open when I sleep). The noise outside, with people and cars, was so bad, I had to shut the windows, and I sleep with earplugs.  Never ate at the breakfast, for it seemed WAY to small of an area, to host any type of a proper breakfast.   As others have stated, it is in a good location, close to the train station and within easy walking distance of Duomo.  I would NOT stay here again and I will be…

title: It's a nice hotel but don't expect a "Palazzo"
review: Here s the thing: the hotel has a great location. parking nearby. coffes, pubs, attractions steps away. staff friendly and helpful. nice lobby. but....I got lucky and my room was the 218...what about it? well, you get the elevator to the 2nd floor...and...get the stairs down (?) to a ...how would I say..."half floor"...kind weird, just like that john malkovich movie ...there were a not a hotel room (?) in front of my room...and the stairs goes down to a door in another street, like a service door. And the room...I asked for a couple room, and they gave me 2 single beds togheter...back pains...and the tv...ok, no one goes to Florence to watch tv, but it coud be something from this century to get the daily news and weather...but the city makes you forget all this...enjoy …

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Very welcoming
review: My family stayed in this hotel for one night in early September. It is centrally located so you easily walk to all the main sights of Florence. The hotel is clean and the breakfast buffet lovely.  The staff is very friendly and extremely accommodating. We needed to book a last minute tour and they arranged everything for us. The most amazing thing was their willingness to help us find a lost item. On our way back to Rome, my sister realized she had left behind one of her purchases at a nearby shoe store (Bata, which is a good 10 minute walk from the hotel). The hotel staff was good enough to send an employee to the shoe store, retrieve the package, and arrange for it to be sent to our hotel in Rome. I was really impressed by this gesture. I imagine most hotels would not extend…

title: A nice reasonably-priced hotel, close to the centre and main station
review: This hotel is centrally situated. The staff were very welcoming, nothing was too much trouble. Car parking in covered car park nearby. Good breakfasts. Rooms not large but well appointed. Air conditioning effective and not noisy.

title: Very clean!!!!
review: Just returned from Florence and stayed four nights here. The Palazzo Ognissanti is five minutes from the station and 10-15 minutes from the Duomo, Ponte Vecchio and Piazza della Signoria. I stayed in a single room which was quite small, but well designed and appointed. I had the impression that the whole hotel has recently been refurbished and everything was bright and squeaky clean. Breakfast was a cold buffet with a selection of ham, cheese, hard-boiled eggs,cereals, fruit salad and yoghurts and a choice of juices and tea and coffee. There was free wireless and wired internet in the rooms, with quick connection and reasonable speed. The thing that lifted this hotel above other similar ones was the staff, all of whom were extremely welcoming and helpful. The surrounding area is…

title: Nice stay with good price
review: I loved staying at this hotel!  It is the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in and I am a former Flight Attendant, so I have stayed in many hotels.  We stayed here for 3 nights.  Great location.  Within walking distance to everything.  The free drink coupon they offer you is nothing great.  It is some kind of punch drink on their roof top deck, but reserve a table if you want to sit up there in the evening otherwise you will be standing.  All other reviews are pretty accurate.

title: A lovely stay
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Nice stay and free internet
review: We were here for two nights and had a very lovely stay. Nothing to complain about, yet breakfast was abit small and understaffed as things on the buffet were constantly running out. The staff are really nice here and funny. The location is five-ten mins walk from everything. It's across the road from a mini-mart and an ATM which is handy.

title: Great place for unexpected delay
review: we stayed at this hotel for 3 days and we enjoyed it.  The room wasn't very big but it was very clean and well furnished.  We had our laptop and the hotel provided free access to the internet in the room which was very appreciated.  The breakfast was ok and the location convinient.

title: Good location
review: Due to a major snow storm, I ended up spending 2 extra nights in Florence. I decided to book this hotel (different from my original place) and I was extremely pleased. This was a very short from the train station in Florence, had a extensive breakfast, and the staff were very helpful with my situation. In fact, I had only booked one night and due to bad weather needed another night and they help me stay in the same room and the same rate! The room was small- yet like all other European rooms, bathroom was clean, nice shower, and I love the heated rack for towels. in fact, I used it to dry some of my clothes.

title: Great location, clean, and good breakfast
review: This is a pleasant hotel in a convenient location, it is within 15 minutes walking from all the main attractions and is also just 5 minutes from the railway station. There are not a huge number of restaurants or bars near the hotel, however as Florence is not that big you only have a 5 to 10 minute walk to reach a plentiful selection. Our only real disappointment was that for our first breakfast there was a hot plate with scrambled eggs and bacon, however this failed to appear for the subsequent 4 days of our stay so sadly back to the usual Italian sticky bun and coffee for breakfast!

title: Excelent stay
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: 4* rating considered a bit generous
review: Great hotel! Large room, comfortable beds, good staff, good location! Everything very clean. Excelent breakfast! It´s a four star with a three star price. I would stay here again! Just need wi fi internet to improve!

title: Should be rated 2 stars. NOISY street. AC only in summer - not on HOT spring days.
review: My wife and I selected the hotel as it was within walking distance of the railway station. The location was convenient for most of the main tourist attractions. It was spotlessly clean, the bedroom was cleaned every day and fresh towels and soaps etc. provided.  The room was small and there was very little storage space for clothing and belongings. We had one wardrobe and some very narrow drawers. Most of our clothing needed to be kept in our suitcases. The shower cubicle was small and the shower head insisted on spraying the walls rather than us, it could not be adjusted.  The air conditioning worked when all windows were closed. This was just as well at night as the streets outside were very noisy with passers by shouting and screaming until 3 or 4 o'clock.  Breakfast was cold…

title: Good Hotel - Centrally Located
review: The Best Westerm website says this place is airconditioned. What it does not say is that the AC does not work on 80+ degree April days. The Best Western website says it is a  4 star place that was recently renovated. Carpet runners in the stairwells were worn, stretched, and a tripping hazard. Room was OK, but certainly not recently renovated. WAY overpriced for what you get. VERY noisy street - and I am a Best Westerm 'Diamond" level guest.... I can only imagine how bad it was for others. Room was uncomrtable hot and you could not open the windows due to the noise. STAY ELSEWHERE! Internet did not work in EITHER of the two rooms we occupied - had to go to the lobby for the wireless...

title: 5 days in Florence
review: Best Western Palazzo Ognissanti Hotel, Florence - is a nice Hotel, centrally located and close to the City Centre. We stayed in this Hotel, which is housed in a renovated 19th Century Building, for four days. It offers a very good value for money and very courteous service by the staff. Rooms are a bit small but very clean and reasonably equipped with amenities and furnishings.

title: Excellent Location, Helpful Staff, Great Prices
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: A tiny room but great location
review: We reached the hotel at about 10 AM and were out sight seeing by 10:30 AM. Ponte Vecchio, Uffizi Museum, Piazza di Santa Croce, Basilica di Santa Maria del Fiore (Duomo), and more all within few minutes of the hotel. We actually even walked to Piazzale Michelangelo in 30 mins!   The Florence Santa Maria Novella railway station is withing walking distance of the hotel.   The hotel staff was most helpful (we had some damaged luggage, they even helped us deal with that as soon as we arrived) and showed us how we could make the best use of our time.  And the delicious complimentary cookies in the room were a very nice (surprise) touch. :-)  I was surprised at the location and the quality of service because we had not paid top-dollar, and were a bit apprehensive about what we would…

title: No Frills in Florence but great service
review: When I entered my room I thought perhaps I had signed up to join a nunnery. It wasn't quite as large as a monks cell. That being said it was very well designed in a minimalist way and the narrow single bed was actually comfortable. What this hotel has going for it is it's great location - 5 minutes walk from the station at Santa Maria di Novella, in a very peasant part of the city and in easy reach of all the sights. The staff are very pleasant and it works well as a "no frills" base for Florence. Major down side of staying that close to the centre on a Saturday night is that I got no sleep thanks to the sirens and street noise outside so bring ear plugs!

title: Noisy location and not worthy of its four star rating.
review: The location of this hotel is perfect for travellers: close to all the sights and a 5 minute walk to the main train station, St Maria Novella. What this hotel lacks in beds (I basically slept on a cardboard box for 3 nights) and hotel rooms, they make up for in service. While I wasn't impressed with my room (totally NO FRILLS even with Diamond status), I was pleasantly surprised with the breakfast buffet....and the coffee was perfection every morning. From the front desk to the kitchen, the staff at this hotel are simply lovely and go out of their way to make you feel comfortable.  The Ponte Vecchio, Uffizi museum and a lot of other main attractions of this gorgeous city are about a 15-20 min walk from the hotel.   Florence is one of the most amazing cities I have ever been to…

title: Great Stay in Florence
review: Front of hotel suffered from street noise due to proximty to communal rubbish bins that were  emptied every day including weekends very early in the morning! The next door cinema made this a noisy location.  The double room was small and basically furnished.  Some staff were indiferent and even challenged us as to whether we were guests at the hotel.  The shared web access in the lounge  was incapable of permitting internet access to the airline site to confirm our reservation.   For a short visit to Florence or business this hotel would be fine but not as a base for several days.

title: good chain hotel, good location!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: A good night's sleep at a central location
review: this hotel is everything you could expect from a chain hotel: clean, confortable and reliable. Except for the fact that we had some problems with the air conditioning in one of the rooms in the first night the staff was fast in fixing the problem the following day.   along with the good location (close to all car rental companies and firenze's city centre), helpfull  staff and an great inclusive breakfeast this hotel is a winner! great for family holidays...

title: Good value but not 4 star for sure
review: Stayed here for three nights. The hotel is just a short walk from the railway station, in a relatively quiet street (at least, by Italian city standards). Noise from the outside wasn't an issue at all in my street-facing room. The room was small, but then, it contained everything I needed: a bed, a chair, a desk, a wardrobe, in-room safe, toilet, sink and shower. And of course air conditioning; quite important in Italy in summer (especially since it worked perfectly).  Hotel has free wi-fi in public areas and free wired in-room internet; wi-fi connection was a bit unstable at times but OK overall.  Breakfast was basic but good enough to get the engine going for the day.  All in all, I was quite happy with this hotel, and wouldn't hesitate to go there again.

title: Great hotel for price and location.
review: Here are the things to know if you are thinking to stay in this hotel. It's relatively clean and nice. Staff is exceptionally friendly. Will help you out with everything. But the hotel itself was not so cozy. The rooms were equipped with all the necessary things but decor is not cozy. And everything in the hotel did not scream cozy. Sheets were not of the best quality.  There is internet with the cable. Ask at the reception. And get the password and username.   Breakfast has many things but if you are a healthy eater then you're challenged. Cause they serve sweet and fat things mostly. Milk is fat, yoghurt is fat, juices are super sweet. And there is not much else. But the coffee was really good.   Overall the hotel is good if you don't pay much. Staff is friendly. Location is…

title: Always great
review: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel in December.  The hotel is close to the main train station which is about a 10 minute walk.  The sights of Firenze are easy to walk to also.  The room had a small balcony attached to it.  The room was very comfortable and the bathroom was larger than expected.    Breakfast is offered and consist of meats, breads, cookies, cereals, and fruits.  Coffee is also available along with juices.  The staff was very freindly and they held our luggage when we chekced out so we could explore the city before leaving.

title: Good choice for leisure holiday
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: ok place, clean, close to downtown & train station, but noisy st
review: Very good hotel for it's price range (we booked quite early and had an even better price), great position(5 minutes walk from the S.Maria Train Station, 10 minutes walk from the Ponte Vecchio), the staff was very polite and helpful. The breakfast was amazing, the croissants are a must. The rooms were a bit small but comfortable. If I were to complain about anything, this would be the room temperature that was a bit high. I'd like to thank especifically Valeria for her attention. The fact is that returning to Florence, I'll certainly look for this hotel.

title: Fine but not memorable
review: Nice friendly staff.  Had a problem with Internet not connecting in the room.  Noisy street.  Close to downtown, train station.  Good breakfast

title: Loved the location
review: Located very near the train station, and near to the river, there's nothing wrong with the hotel but there was nothing special about it either. Only ten minutes or so walk from Il Duomo or Il Ponte Vecchio, but not in too touristy an area. Rooms were comfortable enough, breakfast was a bit limited, but the staff were always courteous and helpful.

title: Perfect last minute reservations
review: We stayed at Best Western palazzo Ognissanti Hotel, Florence for 4 nights in may 2009. The room was modern, with pleasing decor and modernistic furniture. We requested a tea and coffee maker in the room and the hotel even sent us a jug of milk as they had no creamer! The bathroom was a good size and with excellent fittings. The breakfast that was included in the room price was a good spread and as we were vegetarians, we requested for some eggs, and they immediately obliged. Of course the clincher was the central location. We were able to walk in 5 minutes with our luggage from the Station and it was also great location for the Uffizi and the Arno river. The staff helped us immensely by giving us a map and directions to reach vegetarian restaurants. In all a great experience and…

title: Good hotel, but nothing special
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Nice Hotel
review: I had NO complaints about my two nights here. I was comfortable and my needs were met.  But it is a bit generic, and I did not get a warm feeling from the room when I checked in.  I've stayed in more bare-bones hotels that still felt cozy, as if someone had tried their best to make the place a little better than it has to be. Having said that, they did leave us a nice bag of Italian cookies in the room, which was a nice touch.  A benefit is that it's close to the train station, so if you're arriving by train, or want to head to Pisa to see the Leaning Tower, it's convenient.  We were in relatively good walking distance to see the original Statue of David and the painting of Venus.  The desk clerk was very helpful pointing out these locations on the map provided to us.  Internet…

title: A good 3-night stay!
review: This hotel has a great location, friendly staff, clean room and bathroom.  The breakfast buffet was adequate and the service friendly.  The person at the reception desk  (I remember Valeria)  was always friendly and helpful and went out of their way to help.  I'd stay here again.

title: A little above average hotel, great reception
review: The hotel is centrally located, with easy access to the train and bus station. It is also within walking distance to the many tourist attractions in Florence.  The room is fairly new, even comes with a LCD with CNN. The bed is comfy and comes with a sweet turndown service with a piece of chocolate. An amazing touch for a 4-star hotel.  Our stay is value-for-money given the above attributes.

title: definitely you can do better
review: We spent two nights with my wife at this hotel. I just want to start mentioning the great reception we got. Before checking in we ask the clerk if it was possible to make reservations for the Ufizzi and Accademia gallery. Two seconds later it was done... She saved us lots of time. Also very helpful when I needed to exchange some euros. The hotel is much more modern that most I have been in Italy. We got free internet in our room, which was failry big for European standards. The only problem we had is that it was located in the ground level and therefore noisy. Not that far away from downtown (15' walk) and a block away from the Arno. It was cheaper than most hotels this quality. Just make sure your room is not in the ground level!

title: You can do better.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Would definitely stay there again
review: Great location. Good staff  Not much of a room.  Double room very small. Minimal furniture. Not even a shelf in the bathroom for toiletries. Bad smell in room. Worst lighting I have ever seen in a hotel room.  Modest breakfast.

title: Beautiful Hotel
review: Location: The hotel is very close to the river and close to all of the major attractions.   Rooms and general decor: Our room was reasonably decorated with white walls, a few paintings and two beds pushed together to make a double/ queen-sized bed. The ceilings were high and the room was ventilated. Contrary to what I had read from, presumably, obese Yanks, the bathroom was a reasonable size.  The hotel was clean and modern with greatly appreciated air conditioning, providing an oasis on hot August days.   Staff: The staff were amiable and very helpful, especially the ginger bloke who looked like Richard Roxburgh.   Breakfast was organised by a friendly woman, who remembered what my wife and I drank despite the hotel being quite busy. Indeed, she maintained her friendly…

title: Nice Hotel Property near the river!
review: The hotel was great. We had a huge room with a balcony where we could see the river. The area was okay and it was a 10-15 minute walk to the main square. Fantastic place to stay and would stay there again.

title: Friendly, fab Florence
review: This place has nice and helpful staff, a great breakfast, and is about 20 minutes walking time from the heart of Florence. The neighborhood surrounding this hotel is not the least bit scenic. An ATM is located across the street.  Nice rooms.  The river is several short streets from the hotel.

title: Good location. Exellent personnel. Free internet.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Quite happy
review: The location was great. The hotel is really close to the centre of the city. The breakfast was good and very fresh. The room was good size by European standard. I have found the front desk staff more than helpful and quite candidly, better than the service provided in some concierge desks at 5 star hotels.The internet is free, a rarity in Europe.No free parking it costs 15 euro a day. It is discounted from the regular price of 20 Euro

title: Damn good coffee, and hot!
review: I've stayed there overnight, and enjoyed the location between the old town and the SNM station, near the Arno river. There are small shops, bars and ATMs nearby.  Professional and helpful staff, decent breakfast (included), good price when booked online, clean rooms, comfortable beds, free (wired) in-room Internet, big LCD TV with some basic English channels. Functional and clean bathroom (and they provide these free white bathroom slippers). Both reception and checkout were pleasant and efficient. I'd probably stay there again.  Had some problems managing the central airconditioning, maybe it was off. Had to leave the window open, which let some street noise in, but that was OK for me. The bed had comfortable pillows, but only a blanket + sheets to sleep in.  The hotel sports a…

title: Cute hotel
review: This is a nice hotel in a so-so part of Florence. The room was clean, well-appointed with heated towel racks and clay floor tiles, typical of the Tuscany region. It came with a minimal but functional buffet breakfast but more importantly after 10 days in Italy, the first honest-to-God hot coffee I'd had .   The receptionist, and most of the staff I dealt with, were incredibly helpful, friendly, and basically everything you'd want in hotel staff. Their is a small bar, which the front desk runs after hours, so if you fancy a dram, they have a couple of decent Single Malts (sorry, I finished off their Laphroaig).   Overall, while the outside isn't much to look at, it has a decent bed, nice rooms, and is well within the rights to call itself a four star (in Italy at least).

title: just ok....noisy place with mosquitoes
review: My husband and 16 year old daughter stayed her for 4 nights while visiting Florence.  This was a great little hotel. The staff was super friendly and helpful.  The room was large and had a view of a cute street.  The bathroom was small but very clean and up to date tile.  Shower was small but we managed.  Maid service was excellent.  Nice to have elevators that worked.  We had breakfast included in our price, and every day we would go downstairs and eat.  Lots of variety and great coffee!   Good location - wished we were a little closer to the Duomo, but it was only a 10 - 15  minute walk.  About 5 minutes to Arno river. I would reccommend this to anyone with kids.  We had a great stay here especially for the price.  Not super fancy but nice accomodations and in a safe…

title: Rate it 3 1/2 stars
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: A 3-star hotel
review: My husband & I stayed here for 3 nights in early June 2008.   We were on a 4 city bus tour of Italy so the tour company selected the hotel.  I'd rate it 3 1/2 stars.   Our room was very clean.  It did not face the street so it was quiet at night.   It was a good location to be able to walk to various sites such as the Ponte Vecchio, the Boboli Gardens, the Academy Gallery with the statue of David, the San Lorenzo market, the cathedral, etc.    We enjoyed being able to walk to the sites.    A sightseeing tip - if you have a car or transportation, I'd recommend visiting the town of San Gimignano which is about an hour away.    For breakfast, the hotel provided a good variety of foods.  As far as the air conditioning.  The temperature seemed to be preset much higher than the other…

title: fantastic hotel!
review: There is nothing wrong with this hotel. It is decently clean, and the location is quite good. The staff is nice and helpful. But it is decidedly not at a 4-star level, despite what its accepted rating seems to be. (All Italian hotels post their star rating rather permanently, outside. I guess everyone knows that, but point is that it's not the self-rating that US hotels use, it should be more trustable.).  Actually, I have stayed in 4-star hotels in the south of Italy that were similar, but down there your expectations are lower. Up north like this, my 3-star experience (say, the Doria in Lerici) is quite a bit nicer than the Palazzo.  The common breakfast area & bar is spartan and a little depressing, the breakfast itself is packaged cheese slices and small bready things, and…

title: Super friendly staff
review: i stayed in this hotel sharing a triple room with friends and i really cant sing its praises highly enough. The rooms were modern and clean with excellent bathroom facilities. The room sizes were small, but i feel, thats to be expected in this type of city centre hotel. The breakfast was fab with really good service. Overall the staff at the hotel offered an above average service with a positive attitude and friendly demeanor. The hotel is ideally situated for the centre of Florence being about a 10 to 15 min walk away from the ponte vecchio etc. (in fact you can either walk along the riverside or take the street behind and wander past lots of designer handbag and shoe shops!!) We booked through travelsupermarket and paid around £300 for the 3 of us for 3 nights.

title: Pros & Cons
review: Just stayed at the Ognissanti for six nights.  Your experience here will depend on your wants for location, near the station, not so near to centro storico, but still in walking distance.  This is arguably the cleanest hotel of its class and with the most friendly and supportive staff.  All of the staff, desk personnel, breakfast staff and cleaning people went out of their way to be friendly and accomodating.  Note about prior reviewer - if you book a single, of course you are going to get just that - a single.  As far as the AC goes, Florence is just like many other American cities in that they turn the AC on a proscibed date in order to conserve energy.  The Ognissanti does indeed have AC, just not in the period in which you traveled.  I would highly recommend this hotel to…

title: Excellent Value
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Very Modern
review: Location: You're on the outskirts of the city center, but the major attractions are well within walking distance (about half a mile to the Duomo). The train station is no more than a five minute walk away.  While there are certainly many hotels located much closer to the heart of the city, what you get for the location is worth it: a modern hotel with an extremely helpful and friendly staff all at a reduced price simply because of the location.   Their breakfast was amusingly strange: they had Philadelphia Cream Cheese but no bagels.   There is a small supermarket about a minute from the hotel where you can buy the same bottled water restaurants and vendors charge 2 euros for for only .25 cents. The Mercato Centrale, an open air market, is ten minutes away where you can get…

title: Just Ok
review: Very state of the art style Hotel. Rooms on the small size, but a nice clean, very modern Hotel. Rooms have Flat Screen TV's. Very close to out side shopping area. Not to far from train station. Fine place to stay. If you are looking for an old world hotel with antiques etc...well this might not be for you.
